On the other hand, when, in his Republic, he proscribed poets, he did so, as Havelock shows, because they stood for the old oral, mnemonic world of imitation, aggregative, redundant, copious, traditionalist, warmly human, participatory – a world antipathetic to the analytic, sparse, exact, abstract, visualist, immobile world of the ‘ideas’ which Plato was touting. Plato did not consciously think of his antipathy to poets as an antipathy to the old oral noetic economy, but that is what it was, as we can now discern. Plato felt this antipathy because he lived at the time when the alphabet had ﬁrst become sufficiently interiorized to affect Greek thought, including his own, the time when patiently analytic, lengthily sequential thought processes were ﬁrst coming into existence because of the ways in which literacy enabled the mind to process data.

矛盾的是，柏拉图之所以能够清晰而有效地阐述他的语音中心主义，即他对口头语言而非书面语言的偏好，只是因为他可以写。柏拉图的语音中心论是根据文本设计的，也是根据文本辩护的。这种语音中心主义是否转化为逻各斯中心主义和“存在”的形而上学至少是有争议的。柏拉图的“观念”学说表明事实并非如此，因为在这种学说中，心灵只处理阴影或阴影的阴影，而不处理真正“观念”的存在。也许柏拉图的“思想”是第一个“语法学”。

Paradoxically, Plato could formulate his phonocentrism, his preference for orality over writing, clearly and effectively only because he could write. Plato’s phonocentrism is textually contrived and textually defended. Whether this phonocentrism translates into logocentrism and a metaphysic of ‘presence’ is at least disputable. The Platonic doctrine of ‘ideas’ suggests that it does not, since in this doctrine the psyche deals only with shadows or shadows of shadows, not with the presences of true ‘ideas’. Perhaps Plato’s ‘ideas’ were the ﬁrst ‘grammatology’.

将逻各斯中心主义与声音中心主义联系起来的含义是，逻各斯中心主义，一种粗俗现实主义，主要是通过对声音首要性的关注而产生的。但逻各斯中心主义受到文本性的​​鼓励，并且在手写文本性被印刷品强化后不久就变得更加明显，在十六世纪法国哲学家和教育改革家彼得·拉穆斯（Peter Ramus）的思想学中达到顶峰（Ong 1958b）。在他的辩证法或逻辑中，拉穆斯提供了一个几乎无法超越的逻各斯中心主义的例子。拉穆斯,方法,和对话的衰落（1958b，第203-4页），我称其为“微粒认识论”，而不是逻各斯中心主义，即概念、词语和所指对象之间的一对一的粗略对应关系，它根本没有真正涉及到口头词语，而是采用了印刷文本。 ，而不是口头言语，作为思维的出发点和模型。

The implication of connecting logocentrism to phonocentrism is that logocentrism, a kind of gross realism, is fostered chieﬂy by attention to the primacy of sound. But logocentrism is encouraged by textuality and becomes more marked shortly after chirographic textuality is reinforced by print, reaching its peak in the noetics of the sixteenth-century French philosopher and educational reformer Peter Ramus (Ong 1958b). In his dialectic or logic Ramus provided a virtually unsurpassable example of logocentrism. In Ramus, Method, and the Decay of Dialogue (1958b, pp. 203–4), I called it not logocentrism but ‘corpuscular epistemology’, a one-to-one gross correspondence between concept, word and referent which never really got to the spoken word at all but took the printed text, not oral utterance, as the point of departure and the model for thought.

据我所知，文本主义者还没有对他们所谓的逻各斯中心主义的详细历史起源进行任何描述。在他的《拯救文本：文学/德里达/哲学》中(1981, p. 35) 杰弗里·H·哈特曼 (Geoffrey H. Hartman) 提请注意，德里达没有对从（以口头为基础的）“模仿”世界到后来（以印刷品为基础）“传播”世界的过渡进行任何说明。在没有这样的解释的情况下，文本主义对文本性的批判尽管很精彩并且在一定程度上有用，但其本身仍然令人好奇地受到文本的束缚。事实上，它是所有意识形态中最受文本束缚的，因为它仅在历史孤立中玩弄文本性的悖论，就好像文本是一个封闭的系统一样。摆脱束缚的唯一方法是通过对原始口头语言是什么的历史性理解，因为原始口头语言是文本性最初得以发展的唯一语言来源。正如哈特曼（Hartman）所说（1981，第 66 页），“如果今天的思考是文本式的，那么我们应该了解基础......文本是假底。或者，我会说（写），文本从根本上来说是借口——尽管这并不意味着文本可以简化为口头表达。

The textualists, so far as I know, have not provided any description of the detailed historical origins of what they style logocentrism. In his Saving the Text: Literature/Derrida/Philosophy (1981, p. 35) Geoffrey H. Hartman has called attention to the absence of any account in Derrida of the passage from the (orally grounded) world of ‘imitation’ to the later (print grounded) world of ‘dissemination’. In the absence of such an account, it would appear that the textualist critique of textuality, brilliant and to a degree serviceable as it is, is still itself curiously textbound. In fact, it is the most text-bound of all ideologies, because it plays with the paradoxes of textuality alone and in historical isolation, as though the text were a closed system. The only way out of the bind would be through a historical understanding of what primary orality was, for primary orality is the only verbal source out of which textuality could initially grow. As Hartman suggests (1981, p. 66), ‘If thinking is for us, today, textual, then we should understand the grounding.... Texts are false bottom.’ Or, I would say (write), text is fundamentally pretext – though this does not mean that text can be reduced to orality.

文学文本的“解构”源于本文提到的那些文本主义者的工作。解构主义者喜欢指出“语言，至少是我们的西方语言，既肯定逻辑，又同时将其置于边缘”（Miller 1979，第32页）。提出这一点的理由是，如果检查一首诗中的所有含义，就会发现这首诗与其本身并不完全一致。

‘Deconstruction’ of literary texts has grown out of the work of textualists such as those mentioned here. Deconstructionists like to point out that ‘languages, our western languages at least, both affirm logic and at the same time turn it on edge’ (Miller 1979, p. 32). This point is made by showing that if all the implications in a poem are examined, it will be seen that the poem is not completely consistent with itself.

但为什么语言所暗示的所有含义都应该是一致的呢？是什么让人们相信语言的结构可以与其自身完全一致，从而成为一个封闭的系统？不存在封闭系统，也从来没有封闭系统。写作，甚至印刷品，都助长了逻辑是一个封闭系统的错觉。口头文化几乎没有这种幻觉，尽管它们还有其他幻觉。他们没有将语言视为“结构”的感觉。他们并没有通过与建筑物或空间中其他物体的类比来构想语言。古希腊人的语言和思想是从记忆中产生的。缪斯女神的母亲是摩涅莫绪涅（Mnemosyne），而不是赫菲斯托斯（Hephaestus）。建筑与语言和思想无关。对于“结构主义”来说，这是不可避免的。

But why should all the implications suggested by language be consistent? What leads one to believe that language can be so structured as to be perfectly consistent with itself, so as to be a closed system? There are no closed systems and never have been. The illusion that logic is a closed system has been encouraged by writing and even more by print. Oral cultures hardly had this kind of illusion, though they had others. They had no sense of language as ‘structure’. They did not conceive of language by analogy with a building or other object in space. Language and thought for the ancient Greeks grew out of memory. Mnemosyne, not Hephaestus, is the mother of the Muses. Architecture had nothing to do with language and thought. For ‘structuralism’ it does, by ineluctable implication.

上述解构主义者和其他文本主义者的作品的吸引力部分来自于历史上不反思、不批判的读写能力。这部作品中的真实内容往往可以通过更全面知识渊博的文本主义来更容易、更有力地表达——我们无法摆脱塑造我们思维过程的文本，但我们可以理解它们的弱点。文学和口头语言都具有“特权”，各有其独特的方式。没有文本主义，口头语言甚至无法被识别。如果没有口头表达，文本主义就相当不透明，而玩弄它可能是一种神秘主义、精心混淆的形式——这可能会让人无限兴奋，即使在它的信息量不是特别大的时候。

The work of the deconstructionists and other textualists mentioned above derives its appeal in part from historically unreﬂective, uncritical literacy. What is true in this work can often be represented more readily and forcefully by a more fully knowledgeable textualism – we cannot do away with texts, which shape our thought processes, but we can understand their weaknesses. L’écriture and orality are both ‘privileged’, each in its own distinctive way. Without textualism, orality cannot even be identiﬁed; without orality, textualism is rather opaque and playing with it can be a form of occultism, elaborate obfuscation – which can be endlessly titillating, even at those times when it is not especially informative.

言语行为和读者反应理论

SPEECH-ACT AND READER-RESPONSE THEORY

另外两种专门的文学方法引发人们对口语与文学的对比进行重新思考。其中之一源于 JL Austin、John R. Searle 和 HP Grice 阐述的言语行为理论，Mary Louise Pratt (1977) 曾用该理论尝试性地构建了文学话语本身的定义。言语行为理论区分“言说”行为（产生话语、产生词语结构的行为）和“言外”行为（表达发话者和接受者之间的互动环境，例如承诺、问候、断言、吹嘘等） ，以及“言后”行为（在听者中产生预期效果的行为，例如恐惧、信念或勇气）。该理论涉及格赖斯的“合作原则”，它通过规定一个人对对话的贡献应该遵循一个人所从事的言语交流的公认方向来隐含地控制话语，并且它涉及他的“含义”概念，它指的是各种我们为了理解我们所听到的内容而使用的各种计算。显然，合作原则和含义在口头交流中与书面交流中具有很大不同的意义。据我所知，这些不同的轴承从未被阐明过。如果是的话，他们很可能会表明，承诺、回应、问候、断言、威胁、命令、抗议和其他言外行为在口头文化中的含义与在文字文化中的含义并不完全相同。许多有过高度口述文化经验的识字人士感觉自己并非如此：例如，他们认为口述民族在履行承诺或回答询问时不诚实。命令、抗议和其他言外行为在口头文化中的含义与在文字文化中的含义并不完全相同。许多有过高度口述文化经验的识字人士感觉自己并非如此：例如，他们认为口述民族在履行承诺或回答询问时不诚实。命令、抗议和其他言外行为在口头文化中的含义与在文字文化中的含义并不完全相同。许多有过高度口述文化经验的识字人士感觉自己并非如此：例如，他们认为口述民族在履行承诺或回答询问时不诚实。

Two other specialized approaches to literature invite rethinking in terms of orality–literacy contrasts. One of these grows out of the speech-act theory elaborated by J. L. Austin, John R. Searle and H. P. Grice, which Mary Louise Pratt (1977) has used to construct tentatively a deﬁnition of literary discourse as such. Speech-act theory distinguishes the ‘locutionary’ act (the act of producing an utterance, of producing a structure of words), the ‘illocutionary’ act (expressing an interactive setting between utterer and recipient – e.g. promising, greeting, asserting, boasting, and so on), and the ‘perlocutionary’ act (one producing intended effects in the hearer such as fright, conviction or courage). The theory involves Grice’s ‘cooperative principle’, which implicitly governs discourse by prescribing that one’s contribution to a conversation should follow the accepted direction of the exchange of speech one is engaged in, and it involves his concept of ‘implicature’, which refers to various kinds of calculation that we use in order to make sense of what we hear. It is apparent that the co-operative principle and implicature will have quite different bearings in oral communication from those they have in written. So far as I know, these different bearings have never been spelt out. If they were, they might well show that promising, responding, greeting, asserting, threatening, commanding, protesting and other illocutionary acts do not mean quite the same thing in an oral culture that they mean in a literate culture. Many literate persons with experience of highly oral cultures feel that they do not: they regard oral peoples, for example, as dishonest in fulﬁllment of promises or in responses to queries.

这只是口语与读写能力的对比可能给言语行为理论研究领域带来启发的一个迹象。言语行为理论的发展不仅可以更多地关注口头交流，而且可以更加反思性地关注文本交流，就像文本一样。Winifred B. Horner (1979) 开始沿着这些思路进行发展，她提出将写作“作文”作为一项学术练习是一种特殊的行为，她称之为文本行为。

This is only one indication of the light that orality–literacy contrasts might throw on the ﬁelds which speech-act theories study. Speech-act theory could be developed not only to attend more to oral communication but also to attend more reﬂectively to textual communication precisely as textual. Winifred B. Horner (1979) begun development along these lines by suggesting that writing a ‘composition’ as an academic exercise is a special kind of act which she calls a text-act.

另一种特别容易引起口语与文学对比的文学方法是沃尔夫冈·伊塞尔（Wolfgang Iser）、诺曼·霍兰德（Norman Holland）、斯坦利·菲什（Stanley Fish）、大卫·布莱奇（David Bleich）、迈克尔·里法特尔（Michael Riffaterre）以及雅克·德里达（Jacques Derrida）和保罗·利科（Paul Ricoeur）等人的读者反应批评。读者反应批评深刻地意识到，写作和阅读不同于口头交流，就缺席而言：当作者写作时，读者通常缺席，而当读者阅读时，作者通常缺席，而在口头交流中，说话者和听者都在场。互相赠送。他们还强烈反对新批评对实体文本的神化。“文本的客观性是一种幻觉”（菲什1972 年，第 17 页。400）。然而，到目前为止，我们还没有采取什么措施来理解读者对从初级口语到残余口语到高级识字能力的思维过程的演变的反应。对正式话语的规范和期望受残余口头思维方式支配的读者与文本的风格感完全不同的读者截然不同。正如已经指出的，十九世纪小说家对“亲爱的读者”紧张的撇号表明，作者认为典型的读者比今天大多数读者通常感觉的更接近旧式的听众。然而，即使在今天，在美国（毫无疑问，在全球其他高文化社会），某些亚文化的读者仍然在基本的口头框架中运作，以绩效为导向而不是以信息为导向（Ong 1978）。这里的进一步工作机会是开放且诱人的，它们对阅读技能和写作技能的教学具有实际意义，也对令人兴奋的理论产生影响。

Another approach to literature especially inviting to orality–literacy contrasts is the reader-response criticism of Wolfgang Iser, Norman Holland, Stanley Fish, David Bleich, Michael Riffaterre and others, including Jacques Derrida and Paul Ricoeur. Reader-response criticism is intimately aware that writing and reading differ from oral communication, and in terms of absence: the reader is normally absent when the writer writes and the writer is normally absent when the reader reads, whereas in oral communication speaker and hearer are present to one another. They also react vigorously against the New Criticism’s apotheosis of the physical text. ‘The objectivity of the text is an illusion’ (Fish 1972, p. 400). Little has thus far been done, however, to understand reader response in terms of what is now known of the evolution of noetic processes from primary orality through residual orality to high literacy. Readers whose norms and expectancies for formal discourse are governed by a residually oral mindset relate to a text quite differently from readers whose sense of style is radically textual. The nineteenth-century novelists’ nervous apostrophes to the ‘dear reader’, as has already been noted, suggest that the typical reader was felt by the writer to be closer to the old-style listener than most readers commonly are felt to be today. Even today, however, in the United States (and doubtless in other highliteracy societies across the globe) readers in certain subcultures are still operating in a basically oral framework, performance-oriented rather than information-oriented (Ong 1978). Opportunities for further work here are open and inviting, and they have practical implications for the teaching of both reading skills and writing skills, as well as implications for heady theorizing.

显然，言语行为理论和读者反应理论可以扩展和调整，以阐明广播和电视（以及电话）的使用。这些技术属于次要口头语言时代（这种口头语言不像初级口头语言那样先于书写和印刷，而是产生并依赖于书写和印刷）。为了适应它们，言语行为和读者反应理论需要首先与初级口头语言联系起来。

It appears obvious that speech-act theory and reader-response theory could be extended and adapted to throw light on the use of radio and television (and the telephone as well). These technologies belong to the age of secondary orality (an orality not antecedent to writing and print, as primary orality is, but consequent upon and dependent upon writing and print). To be adapted to them, speech-act and reader-response theory need to be related ﬁrst to primary orality.

社会科学、哲学、圣经研究

SOCIAL SCIENCES, PHILOSOPHY, BIBLICAL STUDIES

其他可进行口语读写能力研究的领域只能在此提及。正如我们所看到的，人类学和语言学已经感受到了这种影响，并为我们对口语与识字的对比知识做出了巨大贡献。迄今为止，社会学所感受到的影响并不那么强烈。史学尚未感受到影响：如何解释古代历史学家，例如李维，他们写作的目的是为了大声朗读？文艺复兴时期的史学与修辞学中的口头表达有何关系？书写创造了历史。印刷对文字创造产生了什么影响？更全面的答案不能简单地是定量的，即增加“事实”。印刷品所培养的封闭感与历史写作的情节设计、内容选择有什么关系？历史学家用什么样的主题来打破周围事件的无缝网络，以便讲述一个故事？为了与古老的口头文化的竞争结构保持一致，早期的历史虽然是书面的，但主要是战争和政治对抗的故事。今天我们已经进入意识的历史。这里焦点的转变显然与手写心态的内在化漂移有关。以什么方式？

Other ﬁelds open to orality-literacy studies can only be mentioned here. Anthropology and linguistics, as has been seen, have already felt the effects and contributed greatly to our knowledge of orality in its contrasts with literacy. Sociology has thus far felt the effects less strongly. Historiography has yet to feel the effects: How interpret ancient historians, such as Livy, who wrote to be read aloud? What is the relation of Renaissance historiography and the orality embalmed in rhetoric? Writing created history. What did print do to what writing created? The fuller answer cannot be simply quantitative, in terms of increased ‘facts’. What does the feeling for closure fostered by print have to do with the plotting of historical writing, the selection of the kinds of theme that historians use to break into the seamless web of events around them so that a story can be told? In keeping with the agonistic structures of old oral cultures, early history, though written, was largely the story of wars and political confrontation. Today we have moved to the history of consciousness. This shift in focus here obviously relates to the interiorizing drift in the chirographic mentality. In what ways?

据我所知，哲学以及随之而来的思想史在口头研究方面做得很少。哲学以及所有的科学和“艺术”（对程序的分析研究，例如亚里士多德的修辞艺术）的存在依赖于书写，也就是说，它们不是由人类的独立思维产生的，而是由利用某种语言的思维产生的。技术已经被深深地内化，融入到心理过程本身。心灵与其周围的物质世界的互动比迄今为止想象的更加深刻和创造性。哲学似乎应该反思性地认识到自己是一种技术产品——也就是说，一种特殊的、非常人性化的产品。逻辑本身源于书写技术。

So far as I know, philosophy, and, with it, intellectual history, has done little with orality studies. Philosophy and all the sciences and ‘arts’ (analytic studies of procedures, such as Aristotle’s Art of Rhetoric ) depend for their existence on writing, which is to say they are produced not by the unaided human mind but by the mind making use of a technology that has been deeply interiorized, incorporated into mental processes themselves. The mind interacts with the material world around it more profoundly and creatively than has hitherto been thought. Philosophy, it seems, should be reﬂectively aware of itself as a technological product – which is to say a special kind of very human product. Logic itself emerges from the technology of writing.

分析性解释思想只是逐渐从口头智慧中发展出来的，而且当我们将概念化适应计算机时代时，也许仍在摆脱口头残留。哈夫洛克（Havelock，1978a）已经展示了诸如柏拉图正义之类的概念是如何在对人类活动（口头“情境思维”）的古老评价描述的影响下发展起来的，而这些描述与“正义”概念本身无关。进一步的比较口语-读写能力研究将在哲学上具有启发性。

Analytic explicatory thought has grown out of oral wisdom only gradually, and perhaps is still divesting itself of oral residue as we accommodate our conceptualizations to the computer age. Havelock (1978a) has shown how a concept such as Platonic justice develops under the inﬂuence of writing out of archaic evaluative accounts of human operations (oral ‘situational thinking’) innocent of the concept of ‘justice’ as such. Further comparative orality–literacy studies would be illuminating in philosophy.

很有可能，对中世纪哲学的概念装置进行口头-读写研究，会发现它不如古希腊哲学那样具有口头基础，而比黑格尔或后来的现象学思想具有更多的口头基础。但是，与黑格尔或后来的现象学思想中更复杂、细致的抽象心理分析相比，吸引古代和中世纪思想家的美德和恶行在何种程度上类似于口头叙述中的“沉重”类型人物呢？这类问题只有通过详细的比较研究才能回答，这必将有助于阐明各个时代哲学问题的本质。

It is likely enough that an orality–literacy study of the conceptual apparatus of medieval philosophy would ﬁnd it less orally grounded than ancient Greek philosophy and far more orally grounded than Hegelian or later phenomenological thought. But in what way are the virtues and vices that intrigue ancient and medieval thinkers akin to ‘heavy’ type-characters in oral narrative as compared to more complexly nuanced abstract psychologizing in Hegelian or later phenomenological thought? These kinds of question can be answered only by detailed comparative studies, which would certainly throw light on the nature of philosophical problems in various ages.

总而言之，如果哲学反思其自身本质，那么它的目的是什么？哲学思考不能由独立的人类思维来进行，而只能由熟悉并深刻内化了写作技术的人类思维来进行，这一事实你能理解吗？这种对技术的智力需求对于意识与外部宇宙的关系意味着什么？对于关注技术作为生产和异化手段的马克思主义理论有何看法？黑格尔哲学及其后续思想充满了口语-读写能力问题。黑格尔和其他现象学所依赖的对自我的更全面的反思性发现不仅是写作的结果，也是印刷的结果：没有这些技术，现代的自我私有化和现代敏锐的、双重反身性的自我意识是不可能的。 。

In sum, if philosophy is reﬂective about its own nature, what is it to make of the fact that philosophical thinking cannot be carried on by the unaided human mind but only by the human mind that has familiarized itself with and deeply interiorized the technology of writing? What does this precisely intellectual need for technology have to say about the relationship of consciousness to the external universe? And what does it have to say about Marxist theories concentrating on technologies as means of production and alienation? Hegelian philosophy and its sequels are packed with orality–literacy problems. The fuller reﬂective discovery of the self on which so much of Hegel’s and other phenomenology depends is the result not only of writing but also of print: without these technologies the modern privatization of the self and the modern acute, doubly reﬂexive self-awareness are impossible.

口语素养定理对圣经研究的挑战可能比任何其他学习领域都大，因为几个世纪以来，圣经研究无疑产生了世界上最庞大的文本评论。自从赫尔曼·冈克尔（Hermann Gunkel，1862-1932）提出形式批评以来，圣经学术界越来越意识到文本中诸如口头公式元素之类的细节（Culley 1967）。但正如沃纳·凯尔伯（Werner Kelber）指出的（1980，1983），圣经研究，像其他文本研究一样，倾向于在不知不觉中对读写能力的口头文化的思维和语言经济进行建模，将口头记忆投射为逐字读写记忆的变体，并思考什么是作为一种文本保存在口头传统中，只等待以书面形式记录下来。凯尔伯的主要著作《口头和书面福音》，根据当时最近的口头读写研究，首次正面解决了在对观书面文本出现之前口头传统到底是什么的问题。人们可以意识到文本具有口头背景，但并不完全了解口头性到底是什么。奥康纳（O'Connor，1980）打破了这里的主导趋势，他根据真正的口头心理动力学重新评估了希伯来语诗歌结构。看来，对初级口语的思维和交流过程的深入理解可以为圣经研究打开文本和教义理解的新深度。

Orality-literacy theorems challenge biblical study perhaps more than any other ﬁeld of learning, for, over the centuries, biblical study has generated what is doubtlessly the most massive body of textual commentary in the world. Since the form criticism of Hermann Gunkel (1862–1932), biblical scholarship has become increasingly aware of such speciﬁcs as oral-formulaic elements in the text (Culley 1967). But as Werner Kelber noted (1980, 1983), biblical studies, like other textual studies, are inclined unwittingly to model the noetic and verbal economy of oral cultures on literacy, projecting oral memory as a variant of verbatim literate memory and thinking of what is preserved in oral tradition as a kind of text that is only waiting to be set down in writing. Kelber’s major work, The Oral and the Written Gospel, addresses for the ﬁrst time, head-on, in the full light of then recent orality–literacy studies, the question of what oral tradition truly was before the Synoptic written texts came into being. One can be aware that texts have oral backgrounds without being entirely aware of what orality really is. O’Connor (1980) has broken with the dominant trend here in his reassessment of Hebrew verse structure in terms of truly oral psychodynamics. It does appear that an in-depth appreciation of the noetic and communication processes of primary orality could open to biblical studies new depths of textual and doctrinal understanding.

口语、写作和为人

ORALITY, WRITING AND BEING HUMAN

“文明”民族长期以来一直将自己与“原始”或“野蛮”民族进行对比，不仅在客厅谈话或鸡尾酒会上，而且在复杂的历史著作和人类学研究中也是如此。克洛德·列维-施特劳斯的《野蛮心灵》（1966 年——法文第一版，《La Pensée sauvage》，1962 年）是近几十年来最重要的人类学著作之一，也是本书中经常引用的著作。人们还可以想到吕西安·列维-布留尔的早期作品《Les Fonctions mentales dans les sociétés inférieures》（1910）和《La Mentalité Primitive》（1923），以及弗朗茨·博阿斯的洛厄尔讲座《原始人的心灵》（1922）。“原始”和“野蛮”这两个术语，更不用说“低等”，都是加权术语。没有人愿意被称为原始或野蛮，将这些术语与其他人进行对比以表明我们不是原始人或野蛮人是令人欣慰的。这些术语有点像术语“文盲”：它们通过指出缺乏或缺陷来消极地识别早期的事态。

‘Civilized’ peoples have long contrasted themselves with ‘primitive’ or ‘savage’ peoples, not only in drawing-room conversation or at cocktail parties but also in sophisticated historical works and anthropological studies. One of the pivotal anthropological works of recent decades, a work cited often in these pages, is Claude Lévi-Strauss’s The Savage Mind (1966 – ﬁrst French edition, La Pensée sauvage, 1962). One thinks also of the earlier works of Lucien Lévy-Bruhl, Les Fonctions mentales dans les sociétés inférieures (1910) and La Mentalité primitive (1923), and of Franz Boas’s Lowell Lectures, The Mind of Primitive Man (1922). The terms ‘primitive’ and ‘savage’, not to mention ‘inferior’, are weighted terms. No one wants to be called primitive or savage, and it is comforting to apply these terms contrastively to other people to show what we are not. The terms are somewhat like the term ‘illiterate’: they identify an earlier state of affairs negatively, by noting a lack or deﬁciency.

在当前对口语和口语读写能力对比的关注中，对早期意识状态的更积极的理解已经取代或正在取代这些善意但本质上具有限制性的方法。在一系列已出版的广播讲座中，列维-斯特劳斯本人为“我们通常错误地称之为“原始人”的人们”进行了辩护，反对人们普遍指责他们的思想“粗俗”或“根本不同”（1979年，第17页）。 15-16）。他建议“原始”一词应替换为“无文字”。然而，“没有书写”仍然是一个负面评价，表明存在手写偏见。目前的治疗建议使用不太令人反感且更积极的术语“口头”。列维-斯特劳斯被广泛引用的说法（1966，第 245 页）“野蛮思想总体化”将被译为“口头思想总体化”。

In the current attention to orality and oral–literacy contrasts, a more positive understanding of earlier states of consciousness has replaced, or is replacing, these well-meant, but essentially limiting approaches. In a published series of radio lectures, Lévi-Strauss himself defended the ‘people we call, usually and wrongly, “primitive”’ against the common charge that their minds are of ‘coarser quality’ or ‘fundamentally different’ (1979, pp. 15–16). He suggests that the term ‘primitive’ should be replaced by ‘without writing’. ‘Without writing’, however, is still a negative assessment, suggesting a chirographic bias. The present treatment would suggest using the less invidious and more positive term ‘oral’. Lévi-Strauss’s much quoted statement (1966, p. 245) that ‘the savage mind totalizes’ would be rendered ‘the oral mind totalizes’.

口语不是一种理想，而且从来都不是。积极地对待它并不是提倡它作为任何文化的永久状态。识字能力为文字和人类生存打开了可能性，如果没有书写，这是难以想象的。今天的口述文化重视他们的口述传统，并为这些传统的丧失而痛苦，但我从未遇到或听说过任何口述文化不想尽快实现识字。（当然，有些人确实抵制识字，但他们大多很快就被忽视了。）然而，口头表达并不卑鄙。它可以创造出超越文人能接触到的，例如《奥德赛》。口语也不是完全可以根除的：阅读文本就是口语化的。口头语言和由口头语言产生的识字能力的增长对于意识的进化都是必要的。

Orality is not an ideal, and never was. To approach it positively is not to advocate it as a permanent state for any culture. Literacy opens possibilities to the word and to human existence unimaginable without writing. Oral cultures today value their oral traditions and agonize over the loss of these traditions, but I have never encountered or heard of an oral culture that does not want to achieve literacy as soon as possible. (Some individuals of course do resist literacy, but they are mostly soon lost sight of.) Yet orality is not despicable. It can produce creations beyond the reach of literates, for example, the Odyssey. Nor is orality ever completely eradicable: reading a text oralizes it. Both orality and the growth of literacy out of orality are necessary for the evolution of consciousness.

说精神和文化上的许多变化与从口头到书面的转变有关，并不是说写作（和/或其后续印刷品）是所有变化的唯一原因。这种联系不是还原论的问题，而是关系主义的问题。从口头到书面的转变与心理和社会发展的密切关系比我们尚未注意到的还要多。粮食生产、贸易、政治组织、宗教机构、技术技能、教育实践、交通方式、家庭组织以及人类生活其他领域的发展都发挥着各自独特的作用。但这些发展中的大多数，实际上很可能是其中的每一项，本身都受到从口头到读写等的转变的深刻影响，

To say that a great many changes in the psyche and in culture connect with the passage from orality to writing is not to make writing (and/or its sequel, print) the sole cause of all the changes. The connection is not a matter of reductionism but of relationism. The shift from orality to writing intimately interrelates with more psychic and social developments than we have yet noted. Developments in food production, in trade, in political organization, in religious institutions, in technological skills, in educational practices, in means of transportation, in family organization, and in other areas of human life all play their own distinctive roles. But most of these developments, and indeed very likely every one of them, have themselves been affected, often at great depth, by the shift from orality to literacy and beyond, as many of them have in turn affected this shift.

“媒体”与人类交流

‘MEDIA’ VERSUS HUMAN COMMUNICATION

在处理这个词的技术化时，本书在很大程度上避免了“媒体”这个词（现在它的单数形式“媒介”越来越难以捉摸）。原因是该术语可能会给口头交流以及其他人类交流的本质带来错误的印象。对通信“媒介”或通信“媒体”的思考表明，通信是将称为“信息”的材料单元从一个地方到另一个地方的管道传输。我的头脑是一个盒子。我从中取出一个“信息”单元，对该单元进行编码（也就是说，将其适合它将通过的管道的尺寸和形状），然后将其放入管道的一端（介质，某种东西）其他两件事之间的中间）。“信息”从管道的一端传到另一端，有人对其进行解码（恢复其适当的大小和形状）并将其放入他或她自己的盒子般的容器中，称为心灵。这个模型显然与人类交流有关，但仔细观察，关系很小，而且它使交流行为扭曲得面目全非。因此，麦克卢汉的书名颇为讽刺：媒介是按摩（不完全是“信息”）。

In treating the technologizing of the word, for the most part this book has avoided the term media (with its now more and more fugitive singular, medium). The reason is that the term can give a false impression of the nature of verbal communication, and of other human communication as well. Thinking of a ‘medium’ of communication or of ‘media’ of communication suggests that communication is a pipeline transfer of units of material called ‘information’ from one place to another. My mind is a box. I take a unit of ‘information’ out of it, encode the unit (that is, ﬁt it to the size and shape of the pipe it will go through), and put it into one end of the pipe (the medium, something in the middle between two other things). From the one end of the pipe the ‘information’ proceeds to the other end, where someone decodes it (restores its proper size and shape) and puts it in his or her own boxlike container called a mind. This model obviously has something to do with human communication, but, on close inspection, very little, and it distorts the act of communication beyond recognition. Hence McLuhan’s wry book title: The Medium is the Massage (not quite the ‘message’).

人类交流，无论是口头交流还是其他交流，与“媒介”模式最根本的不同之处在于，它需要预期的反馈才能发生。在媒介模型中，消息从发送者位置移动到接收者位置。在真实的人类交流中，发送者不仅必须处于发送者的位置，而且必须处于接收者的位置才能发送任何内容。

Human communication, verbal and other, differs from the ‘medium’ model most basically in that it demands anticipated feedback in order to take place at all. In the medium model, the message is moved from sender-position to receiver-position. In real human communication, the sender has to be not only in the sender position but also in the receiver position before he or she can send anything.

要说话，你必须向另一个人或其他人讲话。心智正常的人不会在树林中迷失方向，只是随意与任何人交谈。即使是自言自语，你也必须假装你们是两个人。原因是，我所说的内容取决于我所感受到的现实或想象，即我可能预期的可能反应。因此，我避免向成人和小孩发送完全相同的信息。为了说话，在开始说话之前，我必须以某种方式与我要讲话的思想进行交流。我可以通过过去的关系、通过眼神交流、通过与使我和我的对话者走到一起的第三者的理解，或者通过无数其他方式中的任何一种来保持联系。（言语是对非言语情境的修饰。）我必须感觉到对方心里有一些与我自己的话语相关的东西。人类的交流从来都​​不是单向的。始终，它不仅需要回应，而且其形式和内容也是由预期的回应决定的。

To speak, you have to address another or others. People in their right minds do not stray through the woods just talking at random to nobody. Even to talk to yourself you have to pretend that you are two people. The reason is that what I say depends on what reality or fancy I feel I am talking into, that is, on what possible responses I might anticipate. Hence I avoid sending quite the same message to an adult and to a small child. To speak, I have to be somehow already in communication with the mind I am to address before I start speaking. I can be in touch perhaps through past relationships, by an exchange of glances, by an understanding with a third person who has brought me and my interlocutor together, or in any of countless other ways. (Words are modiﬁcations of a more-than-verbal situation.) I have to sense something in the other’s mind to which my own utterance can relate. Human communication is never one-way. Always, it not only calls for response but is shaped in its very form and content by anticipated response.

这并不是说我确定对方会如何回应我所说的话。但我必须能够至少以某种模糊的方式推测出可能的反应范围。为了传达我的信息，我必须提前进入对方的头脑，而他或她也必须在我的头脑中。为了制定任何事情，我必须已经“记住”另一个人或其他人。这就是人类沟通的悖论。沟通是主体间的。媒体模型则不然。在物质宇宙中，没有足够的模型来描述这种意识的运作，这种意识是人类特有的，它标志着人类形成真正的社区的能力，在这个社区中，人与人在内部、主体间共享。

This is not to say that I am sure how the other will respond to what I say. But I have to be able to conjecture a possible range of responses at least in some vague way. I have to be somehow inside the mind of the other in advance in order to enter with my message, and he or she must be inside my mind. To formulate anything I must have another person or other persons already ‘in mind’. This is the paradox of human communication. Communication is intersubjective. The media model is not. There is no adequate model in the physical universe for this operation of consciousness, which is distinctively human and which signals the capacity of human beings to form true communities wherein person shares with person interiorly, inter-subjectively.

愿意接受“媒体”传播模式表明了手写条件作用。首先，手写文化将言语视为比口头文化更具体的信息，而口头文化中言语更注重表现，更多的是一种做某事的方式给某人。其次，书面文本表面上看起来是一条单向信息街，因为文本形成时并不存在真正的接受者（读者、听者）。但在口语中，就像在写作中一样，必须有某个接受者在场，否则就不可能产生文本：因此，在与真实人物隔离的情况下，作者会想象出一个或多个虚构的人。

Willingness to live with the ‘media’ model of communication shows chirographic conditioning. First, chirographic cultures regard speech as more speciﬁcally informational than do oral cultures, where speech is more performance-oriented, more a way of doing something to someone. Second, the written text appears prima facie to be a one-way informational street, for no real recipient (reader, hearer) is present when the texts come into being. But in speaking as in writing, some recipient must be present, or there can be no text produced: so, isolated from real persons, the writer conjures up a ﬁctional person or persons.

“作家的读者永远是虚构的”（Ong 1977，第54-81页）。对于作家来说，任何真正的接收者通常都不存在（如果接收者意外出现，则消息本身的书写就好像该人以某种方式缺席一样进行 - 否则，为什么要写作？）。读者的虚构化使得写作变得如此困难。这个过程是复杂的并且充满不确定性。我必须了解我所从事的传统——互文性，如果你愿意的话——这样我才能为真正的读者创造他们能够并且愿意扮演的虚构角色。要了解缺席者的想法并不容易，其中大多数人你永远不会认识。但如果你和他们熟悉他们所从事的文学传统，这并非不可能。

‘The writer’s audience is always a ﬁction’ (Ong 1977, pp. 54–81). For a writer any real recipient is normally absent (if a recipient is accidentally present, the inscribing of the message itself proceeds as though the person were somehow absent – otherwise, why write?). The ﬁctionalizing of readers is what makes writing so difficult. The process is complex and fraught with uncertainties. I have to know the tradition – the intertextuality, if you wish – in which I am working so that I can create for real readers ﬁctional roles that they are able and willing to play. It is not easy to get inside the minds of absent persons most of whom you will never know. But it is not impossible if you and they are familiar with the literary tradition they work in. I hope that I have somewhat succeeded in laying hold on tradition sufficiently to get inside the minds of readers of this present book.

内向转向：意识与文本

THE INWARD TURN: CONSCIOUSNESS AND THE TEXT

至少从黑格尔时代开始，人们越来越意识到人类意识是在进化的。尽管作为人类意味着作为一个人，因此是独特的和不可复制的，但历史知识的增长已经表明，一个人在宇宙中感觉自己的方式已经随着时代的推移以一种模式化的方式演变。现代研究对从口头到读写的转变以及读写、印刷和言语的电子处理的后续研究，使这种演变依赖于书写的某些方式变得越来越明显。

Since at least the time of Hegel, awareness has been growing that human consciousness evolves. Although being human means being a person and thus being unique and induplicable, growth in historical knowledge has made it apparent that the way in which a person feels himself or herself in the cosmos has evolved in a patterned fashion over the ages. Modern studies in the shift from orality to literacy and the sequels of literacy, print and the electronic processing of verbalization, make more and more apparent some of the ways in which this evolution has depended on writing.

人类历史上意识的演变的标志是，人们对个人内部的明确关注不断增长，因为个人内部与每个人必然被包围的公共结构保持着距离（尽管不一定是分离的）。自我意识与人类共存：每个能说“我”的人都有敏锐的自我意识。但对自我的反思能力和表达能力需要时间来培养。短期发展表明其增长：与早期悲剧家埃斯库罗斯戏剧中的危机相比，欧里庇得斯戏剧中的危机更少的是社会期望的危机，更多的是内心良心的危机。更长期的发展显示出对自我的明确哲学关注的类似增长，这种关注在康德中变得引人注目，在费希特中成为中心，在克尔凯郭尔中引人注目，并在二十世纪的存在主义者和个人主义者中普遍存在。埃里希·卡勒（Erich Kahler）在《叙事的内向转向》（The Inward Turn of Narrative，1973）中详细报道了西方叙事如何越来越关注并阐明内心的个人危机。埃里希·诺伊曼（Erich Neumann）在《意识的起源与历史》中描述了荣格​​框架中的意识阶段(1954) 走向自我意识、善于表达、高度个人化、内在性。

The evolution of consciousness through human history is marked by growth in articulate attention to the interior of the individual person as distanced – though not necessarily separated – from the communal structures in which each person is necessarily enveloped. Self-consciousness is coextensive with humanity: everyone who can say ‘I’ has an acute sense of self. But reﬂectiveness and articulateness about the self take time to grow. Short-term developments show its growth: the crises in Euripides’ plays are less crises of social expectations and more crises of interior conscience than are the crises in the plays of the earlier tragedian Aeschylus. Longer-term developments show a similar growth in explicit philosophical concern with the self, which becomes noticeable in Kant, central in Fichte, obtrusive in Kierkegaard, and pervasive in twentieth-century existentialists and personalists. In The Inward Turn of Narrative (1973) Erich Kahler reported in detail the way in which narrative in the West becomes more and more preoccupied with and articulate about inner, personal crises. The stages of consciousness described in a Jungian framework by Erich Neumann in The Origins and History of Consciousness (1954) move toward a selfconscious, articulate, highly personal, interiority.

在意识的高度内化阶段，个人不会无意识地沉浸在公共结构中，这些阶段似乎是意识在没有书写的情况下永远无法达到的阶段。所有人类与生俱来的口语和无人与生俱来的写作技术之间的相互作用触及了心灵的深处。从个体发生和系统发生的角度来看，口头语言首先用清晰的语言阐明了意识，首先区分了主语和谓语，然后将它们相互联系起来，并将人类在社会中相互联系起来。写作带来了分裂和异化，但也带来了更高的统一。它强化了自我意识并促进人与人之间更有意识的互动。写作是提高意识的。

The highly interiorized stages of consciousness in which the individual is not so immersed unconsciously in communal structures are stages which, it appears, consciousness would never reach without writing. The interaction between the orality that all human beings are born into and the technology of writing, which no one is born into, touches the depths of the psyche. Ontogenetically and phylogenetically, it is the oral word that ﬁrst illuminates consciousness with articulate language, that ﬁrst divides subject and predicate and then relates them to one another, and that ties human beings to one another in society. Writing introduces division and alienation, but a higher unity as well. It intensiﬁes the sense of self and fosters more conscious interaction between persons. Writing is consciousness-raising.

口语与读写能力的相互作用涉及人类的终极关注和愿望。人类所有的宗教传统都有其遥远的口头起源，而且似乎它们都大量使用口头语言。然而，世界主要宗教也通过神圣文本的发展而内化：《吠陀经》、《圣经》、《古兰经》。在基督教教学中，口语与识字的两极分化尤其严重，可能比任何其他宗教传统（甚至希伯来语）更为严重。因为在基督教教义中，将人类从罪恶中救赎出来的独一神格的第二位格不仅被称为圣子，而且还被称为神的道。在这个教导中，父神说出了他的道，他的儿子。他没有为他题字。子的位格是由父的道构成的。在人类作者的背后，上帝作为作者，这是其他著作所没有的。上帝“道”的两种含义以何种方式相互关联，并以何种方式与历史上的人类关联？今天这个问题比以往任何时候都更加集中。

The orality–literacy interaction enters into ultimate human concerns and aspirations. All the religious traditions of mankind have their remote origins in the oral past and it appears that they all make a great deal of the spoken word. Yet the major world religions have also been interiorized by the development of sacred texts: the Vedas, the Bible, the Koran. In Christian teaching orality–literacy polarities are particularly acute, probably more acute than in any other religious tradition, even the Hebrew. For in Christian teaching the Second Person of the One Godhead, who redeemed mankind from sin, is known not only as the Son but also as the Word of God. In this teaching, God the Father utters or speaks His Word, his Son. He does not inscribe him. The very Person of the Son is constituted as the Word of the Father. Yet Christian teaching also presents at its core the written word of God, the Bible, which, back of its human authors, has God as author as no other writing does. In what way are the two senses of God’s ‘word’ related to one another and to human beings in history? The question is more focused today than ever before.

我们现在对口语和读写能力的了解还涉及无数其他问题。口语-读写能力的动态完整地融入了意识的现代进化，朝着更大的内在化和更大的开放性发展。

So are countless other questions involved in what we now know about orality and literacy. Orality–literacy dynamics enter integrally into the modern evolution of consciousness toward both greater interiorization and greater openness.

参考书目

BIBLIOGRAPHY

除了文中引用的作品外，本参考书目还列出了一些可能对读者特别有帮助的其他作品。

Besides works cited in the text, this bibliography lists also a few other works the reader may find particularly helpful.

参考书目并不承诺完整涵盖所有需要口语和读写能力的领域（例如非洲文化）的大量文献，而只是列出一些可以作为主要领域条目的重要著作。这里列出的许多著作都包含进一步探讨各种问题的参考书目。

The bibliography does not undertake to give complete coverage of the massive literature in all fields where orality and literacy are matters of concern (for example, African cultures), but only to list some significant works which can serve as entries into major fields. Many works listed here contain bibliographies that lead further into the various issues.

大多数关于口语与读写能力对比的主要工作都是用英语完成的，其中许多开创性工作是由美国和加拿大的学者完成的。该参考书目集中于英语作品，但也包括一些其他语言的作品。

Most of the major work on orality—literacy contrasts has been done in English, much of the pioneering work by scholars in the United States and Canada. This bibliography concentrates on English-language works, but includes some few in other languages.

为了避免混乱，本书中的材料可以从普通参考资料来源（例如百科全书）轻松验证，但在本文中没有提供参考资料。

To avoid clutter, material in this book readily verifiable from ordinary reference sources, such as encyclopedias, is not provided with references in the text here.

当某些特殊原因需要注释时，条目会被注释。



Entries are annotated where some special reason appears to call for annotation.



Abrahams, Roger D. (1968)“民俗修辞理论的介绍性评论”，《美国民俗杂志》， 81, 143-58。

Abrahams, Roger D. (1968) ‘Introductory remarks to a rhetorical theory of folklore ’,Journal of American Folklore, 81, 143-58.

-(1972)“言语者甜言蜜语的训练”，《社会语言》， 1, 15-29。

-(1972) ‘The training of the man of words in talking sweet’, Language in Society, 1, 15-29.

阿切贝，奇努阿 (1961) 不再安逸（纽约：伊万·奥博连斯基）。

Achebe, Chinua (1961) No Longer at Ease (New York: Ivan Obolensky).

约翰·埃亨 (1982)“唱这本书：但丁喜剧接受中的口头表达”，学术年鉴（正在出版）。

Ahern, John (1982) ‘Singing the book: orality in the reception of Dante’s Comedy', Annals of Scholarship (in press).

Antinucci, Francesco (1979) “关于索马里诗歌语言结构的注释”，侯赛因·亚当 (Hussein M. Adam)（编辑），《索马里与世界：国际研讨会论文集...》，1979 年 10 月 15-21 日，卷。我（摩加迪沙：Halgan），141-53。

Antinucci, Francesco (1979) ‘Notes on the linguistic structure of Somali poetry’ in Hussein M. Adam (ed.), Somalia and the World: Proceedings of the International Symposium... Oct. 15-21, 1979, vol. I (Mogadishu: Halgan), 141-53.

亚里士多德 (1961)亚里士多德诗学，译。以及 Kenneth A. Telford（芝加哥：Henry Regnery）的分析。

Aristotle (1961) Aristotle’s Poetics, trans. and analysis by Kenneth A. Telford (Chicago: Henry Regnery).

Balogh, Josef (1926) '“Voces Paginarum”: Beitrage zur Geschichte des lauten Lesens and Schreibens', Philologus, 82, 84-109, 202-40。很早，但信息量仍然很大。

Balogh, Josef (1926) ‘"Voces Paginarum”: Beitrage zur Geschichte des lauten Lesens and Schreibens’, Philologus, 82, 84-109, 202-40. Very early but still highly informative.

Basham, AL (1963)印度的奇迹：穆斯林到来之前印度次大陆的历史和文化研究，新的和修订版。edn（纽约：Hawthorn Books）。1954 年第 1 版。

Basham, A. L. (1963) The Wonder That Was India: A Study of the History and Culture of the Indian Sub-Continent before the coming of the Muslims, new and rev. edn (New York: Hawthorn Books). 1st edn 1954.

弗朗茨·H·鲍姆尔 (1980)。“中世纪识字和文盲的多样性和后果”，Speculum， 55, 237-65。消息灵通、信息丰富。中世纪文化的领导人基本上都是识字的，但许多人接触书面文本并不一定是直接的：许多人知道文本只是因为有人知道如何读给他们听。中世纪的识字率和文盲率更多地是“不同类型交流的决定因素”，而不仅仅是个人的“个人属性”。

Bauml, Franz H. (1980). ‘Varieties and consequences of medieval literacy and illiteracy’, Speculum, 55, 237-65. Highly informed and informative. Medieval culture was basically literate in its leaders, but the access of many to the written text was not necessarily direct: many knew the text only because they had someone who knew how to read it to them. Medieval literacy and illiteracy were more ‘determinants of different types of communication’ than simply ‘personal attributes’ of individuals.

Bayer, John G. (1980)“ 《红字》中的叙事技巧和口头传统”，美国文学，52, 250-63。

Bayer, John G. (1980) ‘Narrative techniques and oral tradition in The Scarlet Letter ’, American Literature, 52, 250-63.

Berger, Brigitte (1978)“智商争议的新解释”，公共利益， 50（1978 年冬季），29-44。

Berger, Brigitte (1978) ‘A new interpretation of the IQ controversy’, The Public Interest, 50 (Winter 1978), 29-44.

Bernstein, Basil (1974)类、代码和控制。语言社会学的理论研究，卷。我，第二版。edn（伦敦：Routledge & Kegan Paul）。1971 年第 1 版。

Bernstein, Basil (1974) Class, Codes, and Control. Theoretical Studies towards a Sociology of Language, vol. I, 2nd rev. edn (London: Routledge & Kegan Paul). 1st edn 1971.

Biebuyck，Daniel 和 Mateene，Kahombo C.（编辑和翻译）（1971）来自 Banyanga 的 Mwindo 史诗，由 Candi Rureke 叙述，英语翻译。附有 Nyanga 原文（伯克利和洛杉矶：加州大学出版社）。

Biebuyck, Daniel and Mateene, Kahombo C. (eds and trans.) (1971) The Mwindo Epic from the Banyanga, as narrated by Candi Rureke, English trans. with text of Nyanga original (Berkeley and Los Angeles: University of California Press).

哈罗德·布鲁姆 (1973) 《影响力的焦虑》（纽约：牛津大学出版社）。

Bloom, Harold (1973) The Anxiety of Influence (New York: Oxford University Press).

Cook-Gumperz, Jenny 和 Gumperz, John (1978)“从口头文化到书面文化：向读写能力的转变”，载于 Marcia Farr Whitehead（编），《写作的变化》（新泽西州希尔斯代尔：Lawrence Erlbaum Associates ）。

Cook-Gumperz, Jenny and Gumperz, John (1978) ‘From oral to written culture: the transition to literacy’, in Marcia Farr Whitehead (ed.), Variation in Writing (Hillsdale, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates).

Cormier, Raymond J. (1974)“时代错误问题：法国中世纪古代浪漫史的最新学术研究”，语言学季刊， Liii，(2)（1974 年春季），145-57。“前文字社会被广泛接受的特征只在部分程度上适合新的、早熟的、新兴的浪漫小说受众。人们很容易将文盲视为古代传奇故事和其他地方的不合时宜的原因。我认为，无文字社会、口语、活力、争论和外在的精神分裂行为等广泛认可的特征，只是部分地体现了十二世纪中叶的特征。

Cormier, Raymond J. (1974) ‘The problem of anachronism: recent scholarship on the French medieval romances of antiquity’, Philological Quarterly, Liii, (2) (Spring 1974), 145-57. ‘Only in part do the widely accepted features of preliterate society fit the new, precocious, emerging audience of romance. It would be most tempting to posit illiteracy as a cause for the anachronisms in the romances of antiquity and elsewhere. Only in part, I would submit, do the widely recognized features of non-literate society, orality, dynamism, polemicism, and externalized schizoid behavior, characterize that of the mid-twelfth century.’

Crosby, Ruth (1936)“中世纪的口交”，窥器， 11, 88-110。

Crosby, Ruth (1936) ‘Oral delivery in the Middle Ages’, Speculum, 11, 88-110.

Culler, Jonathan (1975) Structuralist Poetics: Structuralism, Linguistics, and the Study of Literature (Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press).

Foley, John Miles (1977)“传统的口头听众”，巴尔干研究， 18，145-53。描述了 1973 年塞尔维亚节日口头表演中的社会、仪式、亲属关系和其他结构。

Foley, John Miles (1977) ‘The traditional oral audience’, Balkan Studies, 18, 145-53. Describes the social, ritual, kinship and other structures in oral performance at a Serbian festival in 1973.

-(1979) 口头诗歌评论：其本质、意义和社会背景(1977)，露丝·芬尼根 (Ruth Finnegan)，《巴尔干研究》， 20, 470-5。

-(1979) Review of Oral Poetry: Its Nature, Significance, and Social Context (1977) by Ruth Finnegan, Balkan Studies, 20, 470-5.

-（1980a）“贝奥武夫和传统叙事歌曲：比较的潜力和局限性”，约翰·D·奈尔斯（编），《古英语文学语境：十篇论文》（英国伦敦和新泽西州托托瓦：Boydell、Rowman）和利特菲尔德），117-36，173-8。表明口服配方到底是什么以及它如何发挥作用取决于其使用的传统。然而，有足够的相似之处来保证继续使用口服配方这一术语。

-(1980a) ‘Beowulf and traditional narrative song: the potential and limits of comparison’, in John D. Niles (ed.), Old English Literature in Context: Ten Essays (London, England, and Totowa, NJ: Boydell, Rowman & Littlefield), 117-36, 173-8. Suggests that exactly what an oral formula is and how it works depends on the tradition in which it is used. There are, however, ample resemblances to warrant the continued use of the term oral formula.

-(1980b)“口头文学：前提和问题”，Choice， 18, 487-96 专业的文章，具有宝贵的参考书目，包括录音列表。

-(1980b) ‘Oral literature: premises and problems’, Choice, 18, 487-96 Expertly focused article, with invaluable bibliography, including a list of sound recordings.

-（编辑）（1981）口头传统文学：阿尔伯特·贝茨·洛德的节日文集（俄亥俄州哥伦布：斯拉维卡出版社）。

-(ed.) (1981) Oral Traditional Literature: A Festschrift for Albert Bates Lord (Columbus, Ohio: Slavica Press).

Forster, E[dward] M[organ] (1974) Aspects of the Novel and Related Writings (London: Edward Arnold).

Fritschi, Gerhard (1981) ‘Oral experience in some modern African novels’, typescript, 282 pp. received from the author.

Goody, Jack [John Rankine] 和 Watt, Ian (1968)“读写能力的后果”，载于 Jack Goody（编辑），传统社会的读写能力（英国剑桥：剑桥大学出版社），27-84。

Goody, Jack [John Rankine] and Watt, Ian (1968) ‘The consequences of literacy,’ in Jack Goody (ed.), Literacy in Traditional Societies (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press), 27-84.

AF 格里布尔 (1957) 《重返岛屿》（伦敦：默里）。

Grimble, A. F. (1957) Return to the Islands (London: Murray).

罗伯特·汉斯·范古里克（Gulik，Robert Hans van）（译和编辑）（1949）《狄仁杰侦破的三起谋杀案：一部中国古代侦探小说》（东京：凸版印刷公司）。原著是一本匿名的十八世纪中国作品。历史上的狄公安，或“狄公”（公元 630-700 年），出现在早期的中国故事中。

Gulik, Robert Hans van (trans. and ed.) (1949) Three Murder Cases Solved by Judge Dee: An Old Chinese Detective Novel (Tokyo: Toppan Printing Co.). The original is an anonymous eighteenth-century Chinese work. The historical Dee Goong An, or ‘Judge Dee’ ( ad 630-700), figures in earlier Chinese stories.

Gumperz, John J., Kaltmann, Hannah 和 O'Connor, Catherine (1982 或 1983) “向读写能力的转变”，载于 Deborah Tannen（编辑），口语和书面话语的连贯性（新泽西州诺伍德：Ablex）。本文于 1981 年 3 月 19 日至 21 日在乔治敦大学第 32 届年度语言和语言学圆桌会议的会前会议上发表。手稿来自作者。

Gumperz, John J., Kaltmann, Hannah and O’Connor, Catherine (1982 or 1983) ‘The transition to literacy’ in Deborah Tannen (ed.), Coherence in Spoken and Written Discourse (Norwood, NJ: Ablex). This paper was presented at a pre-conference session of the thirty-second annual Georgetown University Round Table on Languages and Linguistics, March 19-21, 1981. Manuscript received from authors.

Guxman, MM (1970)“民族语言形成和发展的一些一般规律”，载于 Joshua A. Fishman（主编），《语言社会学读物》（海牙：Mouton），773-6。

Guxman, M. M. (1970) ‘Some general regularities in the formation and development of national languages’, in Joshua A. Fishman (ed.), Readings in the Sociology of Language (The Hague: Mouton), 773-6.

摩西·哈达斯 (Hadas, Moses) (1954) 《古典阅读补充》（纽约：哥伦比亚大学出版社）。

Hadas, Moses (1954) Ancilla to Classical Reading (New York: Columbia University Press).

Hajnal, Istvan (1954) L'Enseignement de l'ecriture aux Universites middlees (布达佩斯：Academia Scientiarum Hungarica Budapestini)。

Hajnal, Istvan (1954) L’Enseignement de l’ecriture aux universites medievales (Budapest: Academia Scientiarum Hungarica Budapestini).

Harms, Robert W. (1980)“Bobangi 口头传统：观念变化的指标”，载于 Joseph C. Miller（编辑），《非洲往事之谈》（伦敦：道森；康涅狄格州哈姆登：Archon），178-200。这些方法的前提是口头传统得以保留和传承，不是出于对过去的无谓好奇，而是因为它们对现在做出了重要的陈述。

Harms, Robert W. (1980) ‘Bobangi oral traditions: indicators of changing perceptions’, in Joseph C. Miller (ed.), The African Past Speaks (London: Dawson; Hamden, Conn.: Archon), 178-200. These approaches are predicated on the assumption that oral traditions are retained and passed down, not out of an idle curiosity about the past, but because they make significant statements about the present.

Hartman, Geoffrey (1981)保存文本：文学/德里达/哲学（马里兰州巴尔的摩：约翰霍普金斯大学出版社）。

Hartman, Geoffrey (1981) Saving the Text: Literature/Derrida/Philosophy (Baltimore, Md: Johns Hopkins University Press).

Haugen, Einar (1966) ‘Linguistics and language planning’, in William Bright (ed.), Sociolinguistics: Proceedings of the UCLA Sociolinguistics Conference 1964 (The Hague: Mouton), 50-71.

-(1973) ‘Prologue to Greek literacy’, in Lectures in Memory of Louise Taft Sample, University of Cincinnati Classical Studies, vol. 2 (Norman, Okla.: University of Oklahoma Press), 229-91.

Haymes, Edward R. (1973) A Bibliography of Studies Relating to Parry’s and Lord’s Oral Theory, Publications of the Milman Parry Collection: Documentation and Planning Series, 1 (Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press). Invaluable. Over 500 items. See also Holoka 1973.

Holoka, James P. (1973) ‘Homeric originality: a survey’, Classical World, 66, 257-93. Invaluable bibliography, annotated; 214 entries. See also Haymes 1973.

Maranda, Pierre, and Maranda, Elli Kongas (eds) (1971) Structural Analysis of Oral Tradition (Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press). Studies by Claude Levi-Strauss, Edmund R. Leach, Dell Hymes, A. Julien Greimas, Victor Turner, James L. Peacock, Alan Dundes, Elli Kongas Maranda, Alan Lomax and Joan Halifax, Roberto de Matta, and David Maybury-Lewis.

杰维斯·马卡姆 (Markham, Gervase) (1675) 《英国家庭主妇》，包含了一个完美女人应具备的内在和外在美德：如她在医疗、外科手术、烹饪、提取油、宴会用品、盛宴的安排、保存方面的技能各种葡萄酒、自负的秘密、蒸馏物、香水、羊毛、大麻、亚麻的订购；制作布料和染色；Dayries 的知识；麦芽制造办公室；燕麦，它们在家庭中的出色用途；酿造、烘焙和所有其他属于家庭的物品。一项普遍认可的工作，现在第八次得到了极大的增强和净化，并为所有人以及这个国家的普遍利益创造了最有利可图和最必要的东西（伦敦：乔治·索布里奇）。

Markham, Gervase (1675) The English House-Wife, containing the inward and outward Vertues which ought to be in a Compleat Woman: As her Skill in Physick, Chirurgery, Cookery, Extraction of Oyls, Banquetting stuff, Ordering of great Feasts, Preserving all sorts of Wines, conceited Secrets, Distillations, Perfumes, Ordering of Wool, Hemp, Flax; Making Cloth and Dying; the knowledge of Dayries; Office of Malting; of Oats, their excellent uses in Families; of Brewing, Baking and all other things belonging to the Household. A Work generally approved, and now the Eighth Time much Augmented, Purged, and made the most profitable and necessary for all men, and the general good of this Nation (London: George Sawbridge).

Marrou, Henri-Irenee (1956) 《古代教育史》，译。作者：George Lamb（纽约：Sheed & Ward）。

Marrou, Henri-Irenee (1956) A History of Education in Antiquity, trans. by George Lamb (New York: Sheed & Ward).

Obiechina, Emmanuel (1975) Culture, Tradition, and Society in the West African Novel (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press). ‘The blending of impulses from the oral and the literary traditions gives the West African novel its distinctive local color’ (p. 34).

O'Connor, M[ichael Patrick] (1980)希伯来诗句结构（印第安纳州威诺纳湖：Eisenbrauns）。凭借技巧和非凡的热情，他利用帕里、洛德和翁的工作，根据有关口头文化及其心理动力学的新发现重新评估希伯来诗歌。

O’Connor, M[ichael Patrick] (1980) Hebrew Verse Structure (Winona Lake, Ind.: Eisenbrauns). With skill and remarkable verve, avails himself of the work of Parry, Lord, and Ong to reassess Hebrew verse in line with new discoveries about oral cultures and their psychodynamics.

Okpewho, Isidore (1979) 《非洲史诗：走向口头表演的诗学》（纽约：哥伦比亚大学出版社）。

Okpewho, Isidore (1979) The Epic in Africa: Toward a Poetics of the Oral Performance (New York: Columbia University Press).

Oliver, Robert T. (1971) Communication and Culture in Ancient India and China (Syracuse, NY: Syracuse University Press).

Olson, David R. (1977) ‘From utterance to text: the bias of language in speech and writing’, Harvard Educational Review, 47, 257-81.

柏拉图。对柏拉图的引用是通过引用通常的斯蒂芬努斯数来给出的，通过这些数可以在任何学术版本和最流行的版本中追踪到这些引用。

Plato. References to Plato are given by citing the usual Stephanus numbers, by which the references can be traced in any scholarly edition and in most popular editions.

Rousseau, Jean Jacques (1821) ‘Essai sur l’origine des langues: ou il est parle de la melodie et de l’imitation musicale’, in Oeuvres de J. J. Rousseau (21 vols, 1820-3) vol. 13, Ecrits sur la musique (Paris: E. A. Lequien), 143-221.

Rutledge, Eric (1981) ‘The lessons of apprenticeship: music and textual variation in Japanese epic tradition’, paper read at the ninety-sixth annual convention of the Modern Languages Association of America, New York, NY, 27-30 December, 1981, program item 487, ‘Anthropological approaches to literature’, 29 December. Sampson, Geoffrey (1980) Schools of Linguistics (Stanford, Calif.: Stanford University Press).

费迪南德·索绪尔 (1959) 《普通语言学课程》，译。作者：韦德·巴斯金，编辑。由 Charles Bally 和 Albert Sechehaye 与 Albert Reidlinger 合作（纽约：哲学图书馆）。最初以法语出版（1916 年）。这是索绪尔最重要的著作，根据他 1906 年 7 月、1908 年 9 月和 1901 年 11 月在日内瓦教授的普通语言学课程的学生笔记整理和编辑。索绪尔没有留下他的演讲文本。

Saussure, Ferdinand de (1959) Course in General Linguistics, trans. by Wade Baskin, ed. by Charles Bally and Albert Sechehaye, in collaboration with Albert Reidlinger (New York: Philosophical Library). Originally published in French (1916). This, the most important of Saussure’s works, was compiled and edited from students’ notes from his course in general linguistics given at Geneva in 1906-7, 1908-9 and 1901-11. Saussure left no text of his lectures.

Scheub, Harold (1977)“口头叙事表演中的身体和形象”，《新文学史》， 8，345-67。包括科萨族女性叙事表演者用手和身体其他部位做手势的照片。

Scheub, Harold (1977) ‘Body and image in oral narrative performance’, New Literary History, 8, 345-67. Includes photographs of gesticulation with hands and other parts of the body by women narrative performers among the Xhosa.

Schmandt-Besserat，丹尼斯 (1978)“最早的书写先驱”，《科学美国人》，238，(6)（六月），50-9。处理公元前 9000 年左右西亚新石器时代的空心粘土大泡和封闭的粘土标记，并使用了数千年，似乎主要用于记录牛、谷物和其他商品的持有或运输。很可能是写作的先驱，也许会导致真正的写作。

Schmandt-Besserat, Denise (1978) ‘The earliest precursor of writing’, Scientific American, 238, (6) (June), 50-9. Treats the hollow clay bullae and enclosed clay tokens from the Neolithic period in Western Asia in and around 9000 bc and used for several thousands of years, it seems, largely to record holdings or shipments of cattle, grain, other commodities. Very likely a precursor of writing that perhaps led into real writing.

罗伯特·斯科尔斯和罗伯特·凯洛格（1966）《叙事的本质》（纽约：牛津大学出版社）。

Scholes, Robert and Kellogg, Robert (1966) The Nature of Narrative (New York: Oxford University Press).

Scribner, Sylvia 和 Cole, Michael (1978)“无需学校教育的识字：智力效果测试”，哈佛教育评论， 48, 448-61。

Scribner, Sylvia and Cole, Michael (1978) ‘Literacy without schooling: testing for intellectual effects’, Harvard Educational Review, 48, 448-61.

Sherzer, Joel (1974) “Namakke、Sunmakke、Kormakke：三种类型的 Cuna 演讲事件”，载于 Richard Bauman 和 Joel Sherzer（编辑），《演讲民族志的探索》（英国剑桥和纽约：剑桥大学出版社） ，263-82、462-4、489。以相同页码重印：德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校拉丁美洲研究所，单行本系列，174（nd）。

Sherzer, Joel (1974) ‘Namakke, Sunmakke, Kormakke: three types of Cuna speech event’, in Richard Bauman and Joel Sherzer (eds), Explorations in the Ethnography of Speaking (Cambridge, England, and New York: Cambridge University Press), 263-82, 462-4, 489. Reprint with same pagination: Institute of Latin American Studies, University of Texas at Austin, Offprint Series, 174 (n.d.).

-（1981）“库纳叙事中结构和功能的相互作用，或者，如何在达里恩河中抓住一条蛇”，黛博拉·坦南（Deborah Tannen）（编辑），乔治城大学语言和语言学圆桌会议 1981（华盛顿特区：乔治城大学出版社），306-22。

Stokoe, William, C., Jr (1972)符号学和人类手语（海牙和巴黎：Mouton）。

Stokoe, William, C., Jr (1972) Semiotics and Human Sign Language (The Hague and Paris: Mouton).

Stolz, Benjamin A. 和 Shannon, Richard S.（编辑）（1976）《口述文学与公式》（密歇根州安娜堡：古代与现代研究协调中心）。

Stolz, Benjamin A. and Shannon, Richard S. (eds) (1976) Oral Literature and the Formula (Ann Arbor, Mich.: Center for the Coordination of Ancient and Modern Studies).

Tambiah, SJ (1968)“泰国东北部佛教村庄的读写能力”，载于 Jack Goody（编辑），传统社会的读写能力（英国剑桥：剑桥大学出版社），85-131。

Tambiah, S. J. (1968) ‘Literacy in a Buddhist village in north-east Thailand’, in Jack Goody (ed.), Literacy in Traditional Societies (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press), 85-131.

Tannen, Deborah (1980a) “口语叙事策略的比较分析：雅典希腊语和美式英语”，载于 Wallace L. Chafe（编辑），《梨子故事：叙事生产的文化、认知和语言方面》（新泽西州诺伍德） ：Alex），51-87。

Tannen, Deborah (1980a) ‘A comparative analysis of oral narrative strategies: Athenian Greek and American English’, in Wallace L. Chafe (ed.), The Pear Stories: Cultural, Cognitive, and Linguistic Aspects of Narrative Production (Norwood, NJ: Ablex), 51-87.

-(1980b)“口语/文学连续体对跨文化交流的影响”，载于 James E. Alatis（编），乔治城大学语言和语言学圆桌会议 1980：双语教育的当前问题（华盛顿特区：乔治城大学）按），326-47。

-(1980b) ‘Implications of the oral/literate continuum for cross cultural communication’, in James E. Alatis (ed.), Georgetown University Round Table on Languages and Linguistics 1980: Current Issues in Bilingual Education (Washington, DC: Georgetown University Press), 326-47.

Tillyard, EMW (1958)《解放的缪斯：剑桥英语研究革命的亲密记述》（伦敦：Bowes & Bowes）。

Tillyard, E. M. W. (1958) The Muse Unchained: An Intimate Account of the Revolution in English Studies at Cambridge (London: Bowes & Bowes).

Toelken, Barre (1976) “黄种人的“漂亮语言”：纳瓦霍郊狼叙事中的类型、模式和结构”，载于 Dan Ben-Amos（编辑），《民俗流派》（德克萨斯州奥斯汀和伦敦：德克萨斯大学）按），145-70。

Toelken, Barre (1976) ‘The "Pretty Languages” of Yellowman: Genre, Mode, and Texture in Navaho Coyote Narratives’, in Dan Ben-Amos (ed.), Folklore Genres (Austin, Texas, and London: University of Texas Press), 145-70.

可见语言（以前的版式研究杂志）。发布许多关于版式、它的构成和发展、它的心理和文化影响等有价值的文章。

Visible Language (formerly Journal of Typographic Research). Publishes many valuable articles about typography, its constitution and development, its psychological and cultural effects, etc.

伊恩·瓦特 (1867) 《小说的兴起：笛福、理查森和菲尔丁的研究》（伯克利：加州大学出版社）。报告。1957年。

Watt, Ian (1867) The Rise of the Novel: Studies in Defoe, Richardson, and Fielding (Berkeley: University of California Press). Rpt. 1957.

Whitman, Cedric M. (1958)荷马和荷马传统（马萨诸塞州剑桥：哈佛大学出版社）。纽约重印：诺顿，

Whitman, Cedric M. (1958) Homer and the Homeric Tradition (Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press). Reprinted New York: Norton,

1965 年。讨论“《伊利亚特》的几何结构”， 249-84（以及第 366 页后四页附录中的图表）。通过环形构图（用开始它的公式结束一个段落），荷马（无意识地？）将《伊利亚特》组织成几何图案，就像盒子里的盒子一样。《伊利亚特》是由一些小插曲衍生而来，《奥德赛》则更为复杂（第 306 页 ff.）。

1965. Discusses the ‘geometric structure of the Iliad’, 249-84 (and diagram in four-page appendix after p. 366). Through ring composition (concluding a passage with the formula that began it), Homer (unconsciously?) organizes the Iliad in a geometric pattern like boxes within boxes. The Iliad is spun out from slight episode, the Odyssey is more complex (pp. 306 ff.).

Wilks, Ivor (1968)“伊斯兰学习在苏丹西部的传播”，载于​​ Jack Goody（主编），传统社会的读写能力（英国剑桥：剑桥大学出版社），162-97。

Wilks, Ivor (1968) ‘The transmission of Islamic learning in the western Sudan’, in Jack Goody (ed.), Literacy in Traditional Societies (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press), 162-97.

Wilson, Edward O. (1975)社会生物学：新综合（马萨诸塞州剑桥：哈佛大学出版社贝尔纳普出版社）。

Wilson, Edward O. (1975) Sociobiology: The New Synthesis (Cambridge, Mass.: Belknap Press of Harvard University Press).

Wolfram, Walt (1972)“社会语言学前提和非标准方言的本质”，载于 Arthur L. Smith（编辑），《美国黑人的语言、交流和修辞》（纽约：Harper & Row），28-40。

Wolfram, Walt (1972) ‘Sociolinguistic premises and the nature of nonstandard dialects’, in Arthur L. Smith (ed.), Language, Communication, and Rhetoric in Black America (New York: Harper & Row), 28-40.

Yates, Frances A. (1966) 《记忆的艺术》（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社）。

Yates, Frances A. (1966) The Art of Memory (Chicago: University of Chicago Press).

Zwettler, Michael J. (1977) 《古典阿拉伯诗歌的口头传统》（俄亥俄州哥伦布：俄亥俄州立大学出版社）。

Zwettler, Michael J. (1977) The Oral Tradition of Classical Arabic Poetry (Columbus, Ohio: Ohio State University Press).

Romantic Movement 16, 18, 22, 26; consciousness 107; memory 150; print 125; psychodynamics 41; theorems 155, 158, 161-2

布鲁斯·罗森伯格28

Rosenberg, Bruce 28

圆形字符148 - 52

圣奥古斯丁36 , 149

第31-3、46-7、74-6、79字； _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 索引122-3；_ _ 所有权128 - 9；打印116 - 17 , 119 , 121 ; 声音90

南斯拉夫25 , 58 - 63

Yugoslavia 25, 58-63

扎伊尔39 , 47 , 143

十二生肖75
