迈克尔·J·兹韦特勒28

Zwettler, Michael J. 28

继ONGIS之后

AFTER ONGISM

网络智能的演变

The evolution of networked intelligence

约翰·哈特利

John Hartley

您只需咨询 Google 学术搜索即可了解 Walter J. Ong 的Orality and Literacy的持续重要性和影响力，该书最初出版于 1982 年。我上次查看时，它显示了超过 7600 次引用，比我看过的任何其他新口音书籍都多。熟悉的，包括迪克·赫布迪奇（Dick Hebdige）（1979）的亚文化（大约 5000），特伦斯·霍克斯（Terence Hawkes）的（1977）结构主义和符号学（超过 1300），以及约翰·菲斯克（John Fiske）和我的（1978）阅读电视（大约 1100 ）。1难怪需要重新发行。但其复兴的理由不仅仅是潜在的销售。该主题的持续重要性证明了这一点，自该书于 20 世纪 80 年代首次出版以来，在电影、广播和电视等视听和电子媒体时代，该主题的重要性甚至有所增加。

You only have to consult Google Scholar to see the continuing importance and impact of Walter J. Ong’s Orality and Literacy, originally published in 1982. Last time I looked, it showed over 7600 citations, more than any other New Accents book with which I am familiar, including Dick Hebdige’s (1979) Subculture at around 5000, Terence Hawkes’ (1977) Structuralism and Semiotics at over 1300, and John Fiske’s and my (1978) Reading Television at around 1100.1 Small wonder that a reissue is called for. But the case for its revival goes beyond potential sales. It is justified by the continuing importance of the topic, which has if anything increased since the book was first published in the 1980s, during the era of audio-visual and electronic media like film, radio and TV.

媒体、电信和计算机技术的融合通过参与平台（包括社交网络媒体、移动应用程序和消费者共同创建的内容）推动了通信模式的进一步转变。现在，媒体受众也是用户，每个用户都是潜在的制作人、出版商、记者、表演者或评论家。用户创造的微生产力很大程度上是口语和读写能力的迷人结合。可以同样有说服力地断言，我们正处于这样的情况之中：Ong 称之为基于电子媒体的“二次口头”，同时：

The convergence of media, telecommunications and computer technologies has precipitated a further transformation in modes of communication through participatory platforms, including social network media, mobile applications, and consumer co-created content. Now, media audiences are also users, and every user is a potential producer, publisher, journalist, performer or critic. Much of this user-created micro-productivity is a fascinating mix of orality and literacy. It can be claimed with equal persuasion that we are in the midst of what Ong called a “secondary orality” based on electronic media, and simultaneously that:

由于电视的发展，阅读量在下降，但从 1980 年到 2008 年，阅读量增加了两倍，因为它是绝大多数人在互联网上接收文字的首选方式。

Reading, which was in decline due to the growth of television, tripled from 1980 to 2008, because it is the overwhelmingly preferred way to receive words on the Internet.

（博恩和肖特 2010：7）

(Bohn and Short 2010: 7)

翁的作品不仅让我们关注“口语”和“读写能力”本身（这作为一个学术领域非常重要），而且还关注它们之间的关系，以及它们在短期和长期的变化或演变的动态。：Ong 是一位媒体变革理论家。一本已经出版了三十年的书自然会受到批评和赞扬。一些人得出的结论是，他的作品和马歇尔·麦克卢汉的作品“在技术上已经过时”（Pettit 2012），因为这两位作家都在模拟时代蓬勃发展，早于数字媒体和互联网的社会普及。这是否意味着他的想法不再相关？“翁主义”应该成为历史吗？或者把目光放得更长远才是明智之举？翁本人赞成漫长的时间。他以 5000 年为单位进行思考，将苏美尔人在公元前 3500 年左右发明的字母文字命名为“塑造和推动现代人智力活动的技术”（口语和读写能力：82）。他断言了书写的重要性，他认为书写“过去是，现在仍然是所有人类技术发明中最重要的”（口语和识字：84）。

Ong’s work focuses our attention not only on “orality” and “literacy” as such, which is important enough as a field of scholarship, but also on the relations between them, and on their dynamics of change or evolution over the short and long term: Ong is a theorist of media change. Naturally, a book that has been in print for thirty years is liable to attract criticism as well as praise. Some have concluded that his work, and that of Marshall McLuhan, is “technically outdated” (Pettitt 2012), because both of these writers flourished in the analogue era, prior to the social uptake of digital media and the internet. Does that mean that his ideas are no longer relevant; that “Ongism” should be consigned to history? Or would it be wise to take the longer view? Ong himself favours the longue durée. He thinks in units of 5000 years, naming alphabetic writing, invented by the Sumerians around 3500 BCE, as “the technology which has shaped and powered the intellectual activity of modern man ” ( Orality and Literacy : 82). He asserted the importance of writing, which he thought “was and is the most momentous of all human technological inventions” ( Orality and Literacy : 84).

他在多大程度上是正确的？每种通信技术的重要性是否会随着其后继技术的发明和采用而下降？马歇尔·麦克卢汉可能是这么认为的——在《古腾堡星系》（1962）中，他优先考虑了印刷术的发明。现在有些人倾向于提名互联网，或者约翰·布罗克曼（John Brockman）自称麦克卢汉派和The Edge的创始人，“世界上最聪明的网站” 2称为“分布式网络智能（DNI）”。也就是说，不是互联网本身，而是互联网所实现的（即外化形式的人类思想）：“集体外化思想，我们所有人共享的思想，我们集体意识与自身相互作用的无限振荡，增加了更充分、更丰富的人类意义的维度”（The Edge 1999；另见布罗克曼2012）。这一选择的意义在于，布罗克曼在千禧年前夕邀请一百多位著名思想家说出“过去两千多年来最重要的发明”的对话中的“最后一句话”。本身。3

To what extent was he right? Does the importance of each communicative technology decline with the invention and uptake of its successor? Marshall McLuhan may have thought so – in the Gutenberg Galaxy (1962) he grants precedence to the invention of printing. Some people now are inclined to nominate the internet, or what John Brockman, self-confessed McLuhanite and founder of The Edge, “the world’s smartest website,”2 calls “Distributed Networked Intelligence (DNI).” That is, not the internet itself, but what the internet enables (i.e. human thought in externalised form): the “collective externalized mind, the mind we all share, the infinite oscillation of our collective consciousness interacting with itself, adding a fuller, richer dimension to what it means to be human” (The Edge 1999; see also Brockman 2012). The significance of this choice is that Brockman makes it as the “last word” of a conversation in which he had asked over a hundred prominent thinkers to name “the most important invention of the past two thousand years,” on the eve of the millennium itself.3

简而言之，聪明的投资者会进行长期思考。沃尔特·翁 (Walter Ong) 很擅长这一点。因此，鉴于他的作品确实继续引起当代学术和辩论的共鸣，我们应该将其置于批评领域。再次强调，这里不是对 Ong 的生活和作品进行全面评估的地方。其他人已经做出了出色的评价，特别是耶稣会传播学者 Paul Soukup (2007)；文化历史学家汤姆·佩蒂特 (Tom Pettitt) (2012)；托马斯·法雷尔 (Thomas Farrell) 撰写的关于 Ong 的大量著作必须为后续的任何努力提供参考（特别参见 Farrell 2000；以及 Farrell's Introduction to Ong 2002: 1–68）。在这里，在口头和识字的有限背景下，我将讨论“Ongism之后”出现的一些问题，以及他受到责备的一些问题。

In short, the smart money is on long-haul thinking; and Walter Ong was good at that. Thus, given that his work does continue to resonate for contemporary scholarship and debate, we should locate it in a field of criticism. Once again, this is not the place to make an overall assessment of Ong’s life and works. Excellent appraisals have already been performed by others, notably the Jesuit communication scholar Paul Soukup (2007); the cultural historian Tom Pettitt (2012); and by Thomas Farrell, whose extensive writings on Ong must inform any subsequent endeavour (see especially Farrell 2000; and Farrell’s Introduction to Ong 2002: 1–68). Here, in the restricted context of Orality and Literacy, I will discuss some of the issues that arise “after Ongism,” and some of the issues over which he has been taken to task.

古腾堡括号

Gutenberg parenthesis

一些当代评论家，如汤姆·佩蒂特（Tom Pettitt），通过认为印刷时代并不构成线性进步或“意识提升”的例子（口语与识字），从而重振了翁的思想路线。：175），而是一种历史偏差。Pettit（2007；2012）提请注意“古腾堡插入语”——口头文化和手写文化之间可能被证明更长的一段 500 年的时期（更广为人知的说法是现代性），对应于 Ong 所说的“原始口头文化”（前古腾堡——或者严格来说前写作）和“第二口语”（后古腾堡媒体和数字素养）。这种方法使得口语和读写能力的话题能够在互联网、数字媒体、移动设备和社交网络的时代得到探讨，而不会将其简化为关于“原始主义与文明”的争论（见下文）。“古腾堡括号”的想法表明，尽管印刷品素养占据主导地位、声望和普遍性，但它在人类思想的漫长轨迹中只是一个例外。

Some contemporary commentators such as Tom Pettitt have reinvigorated the Ong line of thought by arguing that the print era constitutes not so much an example of linear progress or “consciousness-raising” ( Orality and Literacy : 175), but rather a kind of historical deviation. Pettitt (2007; 2012) calls attention to the “Gutenberg parenthesis” – a 500-year period (better known as modernity) between what may prove to be longer stretches of oral and chirographic culture, corresponding to what Ong called “primary orality” (pre-Gutenberg – or strictly speaking pre-writing) and “secondary orality” (post- Gutenberg media and digital literacies). This approach allows the topic of orality and literacy to be pursued in the era of the internet, digital media, mobile devices and social networks without reducing it to an argument about “primitivism versus civilisation” (see below). The “Gutenberg parenthesis” idea suggests that despite its dominance, prestige and ubiquity, print-literacy is an exception in a much longer trajectory of human thought, which may be in the process of restoring earlier modes of communication based on speech and instantaneity rather than space and time-delay.

印刷术最奇怪的事情之一是，它为那些控制出版的人提供了对真理表达的垄断控制（见 Eisenstein 2011）。4它似乎解放了所有人的思想，几个世纪以来受到许多人的欢呼，但这是一种只读的自由。事实上，印刷所采取的制度形式，包括出版和营销行业、科学和其他协会、政府机构，当然还有“新闻界”，将“言论权”集中到越来越少的人手中，尽管将想法扩展到全体人群。

One of the oddest things about printing was that it delivered monopoly control over the expression of the truth to those who controlled publication (see Eisenstein 2011).4 It seemed to liberate thought for all, and was so hailed by many over centuries, but this was a read-only freedom. In fact, the institutional forms taken by printing, which include the publishing and marketing industries, scientific and other associations, government agencies, and of course “the press,” concentrated the “power of speech” into fewer and fewer hands, even as it extended ideas to whole populations.

出版作为言论的普遍替代品的时代相对较短——最多从十六世纪到二十一世纪初。它总是与其他交流方式发生冲突，特别是在家庭关系、虚构想象、社会价值观、艺术、戏剧和音乐等物质享受的口头表达，以及基于服装、食物和性信号的符号系统方面。但随着启蒙运动和伴随着民主化、工业化和消费主义的现代化革命，印刷品无可争议地成为真理（宗教、科学、专业、新闻）和控制的传递者。（监管、审查以及作者和读者之间的极端不对称）。我们可以将福柯通过知识机构（例如医学）管理日常生活的方法与翁格通过印刷品排序知识的方法联系起来（例如，参见 Chartier 1994；并参见 Cavallo 和 Chartier 1999）。在这两种情况下，受到威胁的并不是印刷品的内在或心理“效果”，而是 Ong 本人（1958）所说的“教育主宰”的制度权威及其对印刷品的生产、形式和传播的控制。知识。

The era of publishing as a general alternative to speech was relatively short – stretching from the sixteenth century to the beginning of the twenty-first century at most. It was always in conflict with other modes of communication, especially in the oral expression of family relations, fictional imagination, social values, corporeal pleasures such as art, drama and music, and semiotic systems based on apparel, food, and sexual signalling. But with the Enlightenment and the modernising revolutions that accompanied democratisation, industrialisation and consumerism, print became the undisputed conveyor of both truth (religious, scientific, professional, journalistic) and control (regulation, censorship, and the extreme asymmetry between writers and readers). We may link a Foucauldian approach to the administration of everyday life via institutions of knowledge (such as medicine) with an Ongian approach to the ordering of knowledge via print (for instance, see Chartier 1994; and see Cavallo and Chartier 1999). In both cases, it is not so much the intrinsic or psychological “effect” of print that’s at stake, but the institutional authority of what Ong himself (1958) called “the pedagogical juggernaut” and its control over the production, form and dissemination of knowledge.

只是随着数字互动媒体的发展，这个“括号”才可以被视为历史上的一个离散时期，而不是一个不可避免的进化步骤。在互联网时代，比以前更多的人可以通过自己出版来利用识字能力，包括印刷品识字能力。因此，我们正处于一个口头、书面和印刷文字模式前所未有的融合的时代，像语音交流这样的口头形式正在迁移到网络上，轮流说话的模式通过链接、照片和文件共享得到增强，私人谈话也是全球出版物，文字是多媒体素养的多模式使用比以前覆盖了更广泛的人群（参见 Baron 2009；Rettberg 2008；Papacharissi 2011）。在新媒体时代，重新思考口头和读写（书面和印刷）之间的关系显然很重要。

It is only with the growth of the digital interactive media that this “parenthesis” can be seen as a discrete period in history, rather than an inevitable evolutionary step. In the era of the internet, vastly more people than before can make use of literacy, including print-literacy, by publishing it for themselves. So we are in a time of unprecedented convergence among oral, written and print-literate modes, where oral forms like phatic communication are migrating to the web, the turn-taking modes of speech are augmented by links, photos, and file-sharing, private conversations are also global publications, text is literally hyper-inflated, and these multi-modal uses of multimedia literacy extend across much wider sections of the population than heretofore (see Baron 2009; Rettberg 2008; Papacharissi 2011). It is clearly important to rethink the relations between orality and literacy – both written and print – for the new media age.

进步主义种族中心主义

Progressivist ethnocentrism

鉴于“翁主义之前”一章中概述的美国主义历史，一些人认为有必要扰乱或破坏历史叙事，从而在翁对从口头文化到文字文化的转变的描述中留下西方进步主义的味道。当然，一些评论家很想指责他更喜欢与口头思维方式相比，识字思维方式更为先进或文明（Svehla 2006：106-8；Moje 和 Luke 2009）。然而，尽管他普遍习惯于将西方思想与人类思想等同起来，但翁对欧洲历史传统的依恋不能被视为“新英格兰”清教主义对当代科学、商业和媒体的简单普遍化。首先，像他的导师麦克卢汉一样，翁是一名天主教徒。事实上，就像当时的另一位激进思想煽动者伊万·伊利奇一样，他是一名耶稣会牧师。他在耶稣会圣路易斯大学任教，与大多数当代新教徒不同，他可以轻松地使用拉丁语。因此，他不能被认为是宗教改革或“朴素风格”的简单辩护者，尽管他的巨著致力于彼得·拉穆斯的作品，

Given the history of Americanism outlined in the Chapter “Before Ongism,” it has been seen by some as necessary to disturb or disrupt the historical narrative that leaves a whiff of Western progressivism in Ong’s account of the transition from oral to literate cultures. Certainly some commentators have been tempted to accuse him of preferring literate modes of thought as more advanced or civilised, compared with oral ones (Svehla 2006: 106–8; Moje and Luke 2009). However, despite his generally relaxed habit of equating Western thought with the human mind, Ong’s attachment to European historical traditions cannot be seen as a simple universalisation of “New England” Puritanism for contemporary science, commerce and media. For a start, like his mentor McLuhan, Ong was a Catholic; indeed, like that other radical thought-provocateur of the day, Ivan Illich, he was a Jesuit priest. He taught at the Jesuit St Louis University, and was at ease in the Latin tongue, unlike most contemporary Protestants. Therefore, he cannot be thought of as a simple apologist for the Reformation or “plain style,” even though his magnum opus was devoted to the work of Peter Ramus, Protestant pedagogue and founder of modern method, who was himself murdered by Catholic terrorists in the St Bartholomew’s Day Massacre of 1572 (Ong 1958: 29).

翁可能有理由将新教改革视为对令人钦佩的体系的不幸中断——一个“括号”——而不是理性知识不可避免的进步。他认为“古老的口述、记忆的模仿、聚合、冗余、丰富、传统主义、热情人性、参与性的世界”与“[柏拉图式]分析的、稀疏的、精确的、抽象的、视觉主义的、固定的世界之间存在着“反感”。他认为，“思想”（口语和读写能力：164）是字母读写能力的结果（通过印刷读写能力扩大了许多倍）。此帐户并不意味着进步（辉格党）技术和认知“进步”的叙述。有充分的证据表明 Ong 对口语模式的喜爱。在他的手中，人们甚至可以称它们为堕落前的东西，并推测，书写及其过度活跃的后代印刷术被翁视为另一种堕落，是人类过度消费知识之树的结果。翁将拉米斯主义描述为“古老的口耳听觉世界从史诗般的苍穹坠入印刷文明的海洋时所释放的最后火花”（Ong 2002：303）。也许，这个堕落不是犹太基督教亚当的堕落，而是古典伊卡洛斯的堕落，在普罗米修斯的火花中。不管怎样，它都是知识超越自身的结果。

Ong may have had reason to see the Protestant Reformation as an unfortunate interruption to an admired system – a “parenthesis” – rather than an inevitable advance in rational knowledge. He sees an “antipathy” between the “old oral, mnemonic world of imitation, aggregative, redundant, copious, traditionalist, warmly human, participatory,” and the “analytic, sparse, exact, abstract, visualist, immobile world of [platonic] ‘ideas’” ( Orality and Literacy : 164) that were, he argued, a consequence of alphabetic literacy (scaled up many-fold by print-literacy). This account does not imply a progressive (Whiggish) narrative of technological and cognitive “advance.” There is ample evidence of Ong’s attachment to oral modes; in his hands one might even call them prelapsarian, and speculate that writing, together with its hyperactive progeny, printing, was seen by Ong as another Fall, consequent upon human over-consumption of the tree of knowledge. Ong characterised Ramism as “the final shower of sparks released by an old oral-aural world as it was plunging from the epic firmament into the sea of a typographical civilization” (Ong 2002: 303). This Fall is not that of Judeo-Christian Adam, perhaps, but of Classical Icarus, in a Promethean shower of sparks. Either way, it results from knowledge overreaching itself.

因此，没有必要像兰斯·斯韦拉那样得出结论，认为翁对口头世界和书面世界之间差异的描述相当于一种“现代主义认识论”，特别是教育工作者必须从中得出结论，当代学生，尤其是那些在内城区和贫困社区接触书籍的机会较少，“被多种媒体模式所饱和”并且“扎根于偶像”，因此“文化缺陷和认知障碍”（Svehla 2006：108-9）。翁的作品同样可以被解读为对修辞（天主教）中世纪主义的偏好，而不是（新教）现代性的空间抽象；从那时起，麦克卢汉就热情欢迎通过电子媒体使当代世界重新中世纪化，他将其称为“第二口头语言”。5这里的“次要”并不意味着低劣；而是意味着次要。唯一的顺序。

There is no need to conclude, therefore, as Lance Svehla does, that Ong’s account of the difference between oral and written worlds amounts to a “modernist epistemology,” from which educators in particular would be obliged to conclude that contemporary students, especially those in inner cities and poor neighbourhoods with low exposure to books, who are “saturated by multiple media modes” and “grounded as they are in the icon,” are therefore “culturally deficient and cognitively impaired” (Svehla 2006: 108–9). Ong’s work can equally be read as a preference for rhetorical (Catholic) Medievalism over the spatial abstractions of (Protestant) modernity; and thence, with McLuhan, as welcoming the re-Medievalisation of the contemporary world through the electronic media, which he named as “secondary orality.”5 Here, “secondary” does not imply inferiority; only sequence.

当然，种族中心主义的指控可能仍然是合理的，因为翁自己承认，他专注于字母书写的古典发明及其在欧洲和西方文化中的采用，而不是将其与来自美索不达米亚、东亚的截然不同的传统进行比较。中美洲“等等”（口语和识字：3）。简而言之，翁将只能在近代西方传统中观察到的东西普遍化为人类。但并非所有公民都如此。

Of course, a charge of ethnocentrism may still be in order, because by his own admission Ong concentrates on the Classical invention of alphabetic writing and its uptake in Europe and Western cultures, rather than comparing this with very different traditions from Mesopotamia, East Asia, Meso-America “and so on” ( Orality and Literacy : 3). In short, Ong universalises as human what may arguably be observed only in recent Western traditions; and not in all of their citizens.

当代人的情感更加“天主教”，他们愿意承认 Ong 所忽视的传统的作用。试图讲述整个人类文明的完整故事的艰巨工作已经开始尝试。一个广受好评的例子是《100件物品中的世界史》（MacGregor 2010）。这个项目以口头形式开始，作为一个口头广播系列，并以数字形式继续发展，作为一个广泛使用的网站。6大英博物馆馆长尼尔·麦格雷戈讲述了所有有人居住的大陆和许多文明的世界历史。他完全通过物体来做到这一点，从近两百万年前早期人类的奥杜威石制砍刀，到最近在中国制造的太阳能灯套件。

Contemporary sensibilities are more “catholic” in their willingness to admit the role of the traditions Ong skates over; and the difficult work of seeking to tell an integrated story of human civilisation as a whole has begun to be attempted. A widely praised example is A History of the World in 100 Objects (MacGregor 2010). This project began life orally, as a spoken radio series, and it continues digitally, as a well-used website.6 Neil MacGregor, director of the British Museum, narrates world history from all inhabited continents and many civilisations. He does this entirely through objects, from the Olduvai stone chopping tools of early hominins, made nearly two million years ago, to a recently made-in-China solar-powered lamp kit.

这种方法不仅显示了种族中心主义如何被取代，而且还显示了以逻各斯为中心的知识方法的局限性。它提醒我们不要认为知识仅由文字（无论是否书面）来承载，因此通信技术本身的变化就可以改变人类意识。尼尔·麦格雷戈（Neil MacGregor，2010：658）总结道：“物体迫使我们谦虚地承认，自从我们的祖先离开东非来到这个世界以来，我们几乎没有改变。” 人类思想发生了多大变化的问题仍然悬而未决。但在这段时间里，不可否认的是它呈指数级增长，其中大部分编码在事物、关系、制度和实践以及文字中。翁的作品最有价值的是作为知识史的一部分，而不是意识史。

Not only does such an approach show how ethnocentrism might be superseded, it also shows the limits of a logocentric approach to knowledge. It cautions us against the assumption that knowledge is carried by words alone, whether written or not, and thus that changes in communication technologies by themselves can change human consciousness. Neil MacGregor (2010: 658) concludes that “objects force us to the humble recognition that since our ancestors left East Africa to populate the world we have changed very little.” The question of how much the human mind has changed remains open. But over that span of time there’s no denying that knowledge has grown exponentially, much of it encoded in things, relationships, institutions and practices, as well as words. Ong’s work is at its most valuable as part of the history of knowledge, not consciousness.

二元论

Binarism

当 Ong 提出口语世界与读写能力“格格不入”时（口语与读写能力：164），他自己的偏好，无论是否受到宗教启发，是否会左右摇摆并不重要；无论他更喜欢其中之一。更深层次的问题在于假设这些类别是二元对立的（这就是“反感”所需要的），并且字母书写系统的采用，以及随后的活字印刷，导致了人类认识方式的变化。尽管他批评结构主义者的二元思维（口语和读写能力：161），但这种倾向确实构建了翁在口语和读写能力方面的方法。作为他思想的一个方面，这一观点得到了一群有影响力的作家的认同，他们的作品在 20 世纪 60 年代中期变得著名。其中包括人类学家杰克·古迪爵士（Sir Jack Goody，eg 1977），他的观点对文学、文化和媒体研究产生了影响，他与小说理论家伊恩·瓦特（Ian Watt）合着了一篇被广泛收录的文章，题为《读写能力的后果》。 ”（古迪和瓦特 1963）。7

When Ong proposes the oral world as “antipathetic” to literacy ( Orality and Literacy : 164), it matters less whether his own predilections, religiously-inspired or not, swing one way or the other; whether he prefers one or the other. A deeper problem lies in the assumption that these categories are binarily opposed (which is what “antipathy” requires), and that the adoption of alphabetic writing systems, and then of printing with moveable type, causes changes in the way humans know. Despite the fact that he criticised binary thinking among the structuralists ( Orality and Literacy : 161), this tendency does structure Ong’s approach in Orality and Literacy. As an aspect of his thought it was shared with an influential group of writers whose work became prominent in the mid-1960s. These included the anthropologist Sir Jack Goody (e.g. 1977), whose views were influential in literary, cultural and media studies through a much-anthologised article that he co-authored with Ian Watt, the theorist of the novel, called “The Consequences of Literacy” (Goody and Watt 1963).7

二元论自然地与大陆结构主义人类学相吻合，尤其是克洛德·列维-斯特劳斯的结构主义人类学，例如他在《La Pensée Sauvage》（1962）中对“拼凑”（口头）和“工程”（文学）思维模式的区分。通过埃德蒙·利奇爵士（Sir Edmund Leach，1976）等解释者，二元论与结构人类学一起进入了英语圈。它支撑了麦克卢汉的著作，尤其是《古腾堡银河》（ The Gutenberg Galaxy，1962）和他的导师哈罗德·英尼斯（Harold Innis，1950；1951）的著作。它得到了英尼斯在加拿大的同时代人埃里克·哈夫洛克（Eric Havelock）（对 Ong 的主要影响：参见口语和读写能力：27-8）的强烈支持，他为柏拉图写了序言（1963）在哈佛大学任职后出版。哈夫洛克越来越坚定地认为，希腊字母的发明改变了一切：

Naturally binarism dovetailed with Continental structuralist anthropology, especially that of Claude Lévi-Strauss, for instance in his distinction between “bricolage” (oral) and “engineering” (literate) modes of thought in La Pensée Sauvage (1962). Binarism crossed into the Anglosphere with structural anthropology, via interpreters such as Sir Edmund Leach (1976). It underpinned McLuhan’s work, especially The Gutenberg Galaxy (1962) and that of his mentor, Harold Innis (1950; 1951). It was strongly endorsed by Innis’s contemporary in Canada, Eric Havelock (a major influence on Ong: see Orality and Literacy : 27–8), whose Preface to Plato (1963) was published after a stint at Harvard. Havelock held – increasingly rigidly – that the invention of the Greek alphabet changed everything:

与包括腓尼基字母在内的所有先前系统相反，希腊字母的发明构成了人类文化史上的一个事件，其重要性尚未得到充分认识。它的出现将所有前希腊文明与后希腊文明区分开来。

The invention of the Greek alphabet, as opposed to all previous systems, including the Phoenician, constituted an event in the history of human culture, the importance of which has not as yet been fully grasped. Its appearance divides all pre-Greek civilizations from those that are post-Greek.

（1977：369）

(1977: 369)

对二元对立的分析在媒体和文化研究中产生了影响，尤其是通过我自己在新口音系列中合着的书《阅读电视》（菲斯克和哈特利，1978）。我们提出了口头思维模式和书面思维模式之间的一系列差异。我们的目的不是让他们反对，而是相反：我们想通过展示其口头或“吟游诗人”逻辑来反击我们所看到的学者和专业精英对大众电视的印刷偏见。我们希望恢复“口语模式”作为合法的研究对象；也就是说，不是创造而是重新平衡两者之间的“巨大鸿沟”。尽管如此，使用二元论，即使是出于分析目的，也具有使口语和识字在某种程度上“相反”的观点合法化的效果——这是一个未经检验的假设，即翁的书在我们的同一个新口音系列中于我们的书晚了四年出版，没有起到任何作用。驱散。

Analysis of binary oppositions became influential in media and cultural studies, not least through my own co-authored book in the New Accents series, Reading Television (Fiske and Hartley 1978). We posited a series of differences between oral and literate modes of thought. Our purpose was not to keep them opposed, but rather the reverse: we wanted to counter what we saw as the print-literate prejudices of scholars and professional elites against popular television, by demonstrating its oral or “bardic” logic. We wanted to reinstate “oral modes” as a legitimate object of study; i.e. not to create but to rebalance the “great divide” between the two. Nonetheless, the use of binarism, even for analytical purposes, has the effect of legitimating the idea that orality and literacy are somehow “antipathetic” – an untested assumption that Ong’s book, published four years after ours in the same New Accents series, did nothing to dispel.

教育学原始主义

Pedagogic primitivism

David Olson 和 Nancy Torrance (1991: 7) 将这种二元方法称为“大分水岭”理论。“大分水岭”理论的问题——超出了对其进行实证检验的挑战——在应用时尤其是在课堂上最为尖锐。在大卫·奥尔森（David Olson，2003）的评论之后，在识字专业人士中，它被称为“大跃进”理论，他需要“大分歧”才能主张学校教育改革：

David Olson and Nancy Torrance (1991: 7) call this binary approach the “great-divide” theory. The problems with “great-divide” theory – beyond the challenge of testing it empirically – are most acute when it is applied, specifically in the classroom. Among literacy professionals it became known as “Great Leap” theory, following a remark of David Olson (2003), who needed a “great divide” in order to argue for the reform of schooling:

那么，我们所需要的是对学校作为官僚机构的理解的进步，这与我们对心灵发展的理解的进步相对应……更好地理解心理学理论与教育改革之间的关系。

What is required, then, is an advance in our understanding of schools as bureaucratic institutions that corresponds to the advances in our understanding of the development of the mind... a better understanding of the relation between psychological theory and educational reform.

（2003年：十一）

(2003: xi)

识字的“大跃进”理论由此而来：“我曾假设，如果我们更多地了解……人们如何学习，教育实践就会取得巨大的飞跃。” （奥尔森 2003：ix）。学校教育和学习之间的感知差距（前者无法必然带来后者）被投射到印刷读写能力和口头思维模式之间基于社会阶层的感知差异上。人们认为，至少改良主义者不需要发动阶级斗争通过普及有文化的精英的价值观来帮助穷人。相反，议程是改革机构环境中的教学法，考虑到口头学习模式（实际上与十六世纪的拉米斯特项目相反，旨在消除其教学机构遗产），以促进知识解放人口作为一个整体（参见 Kintgen 等人 1988 年的这些观点和相反的观点）。

The “Great Leap” Theory of Literacy follows from this: “I had assumed that if only we knew more about... how people learn, educational practice would take a great leap forward.” (Olson 2003: ix). The perceived gap between schooling and learning, where the former fails to entail the latter, is projected onto a perceived difference – based on social class – between print literacy and oral modes of thought. At the very least, it was thought, reformists needed not to wage class struggle against the have-nots by universalising the values of the literate elite. Instead, the agenda was to reform pedagogies in institutional settings with oral modes of learning in mind (effectively the opposite of the Ramist project of the sixteenth century, designed to undo its pedagogical-institutional legacy), with a view to promoting the intellectual emancipation of the population as a whole (see Kintgen et al 1988 for these and opposing perspectives).

文学证书主义文化——通过笔试对个人进行认证——现在比翁撰写《口语与识字》时更占主导地位。“教育巨头”现在是教育认证领域的全球竞争市场。印刷素养是科学、研究、教学和社会机构的媒介，主要通过认证和考试来获取，即政府、行政管理、商业和商业、知识生活和专业。这与 Ong 所说的“第二口语”形成鲜明对比，即以电子为媒介的口头表达和交流模式，这是这些学生（包括许多来自充满挑战的环境的学生，他们的感官在流行文化和媒体、时尚中培养的）所青睐的非正式交流和学习模式。以及消费、在线和街头社交网络。这种从阶级区分的角度对交流模式进行理论化的尝试随后被应用于教育计划中，这些教育计划旨在颠覆那些用于再生产知识的机构内既定的知识等级制度。这种教育解放主义继承了保罗·弗雷雷（Paulo Freire，1970）、伊万·伊里奇（Ivan Illich，1971）以及沃尔特·翁（Walter Ong）等天主教学者的激进教育学。它的动机是希望“口头”思维方式与“文字”思维方式同等重要，甚至高于“文字”思维方式。在教育学中的拉米斯特括号周围画一个右括号。

The culture of literate credentialism – of certificating individuals through written examination – is if anything more dominant now than it was when Ong wrote Orality and Literacy. The “pedagogical juggernaut” is now a global competitive market in educational certification. Print literacy is the medium of science, research, teaching, and social institutions accessible chiefly by certification and examination, i.e. government, administration, commerce and business, intellectual life and the professions. This contrasts with what Ong calls “secondary orality,” i.e. electronically mediated oral modes of expression and communication, the favoured mode of informal communication and learning among those students, including many from challenging environments, whose senses are nurtured in popular culture and media, fashion and consumption, social networks online and in the street. This attempt to theorise modes of communication in terms of class distinction is then applied through educational programs designed to upend the established hierarchies of knowledge within the very institutions that serve to reproduce them. This kind of educational emancipationism channels the radical pedagogies of Catholic savants like Paulo Freire (1970) and Ivan Illich (1971) as well as Walter Ong. It was motivated by a desire to value “oral” modes of thought equally with or even above “literate” ones; to draw a closing bracket around the Ramist parenthesis in pedagogy.

一些人在这种努力中发现了部落主义的痕迹，这是一种“高贵的野蛮”浪漫主义，而 20 世纪 60 年代的一代似乎特别成为猎物——就像罗伯特·皮尔西格和卡洛斯·卡斯特内达那样。8沃尔特·翁 (Walter Ong) 也未能幸免，尽管他试图重视他所谓的“文化较简单的民族”和“较原始的民族”的仪式生活（Ong 1971：115）。因此，他将文艺复兴时期的拉丁语学习与青春期仪式进行了比较，他认为青春期仪式“本质上是说教性的”：

Some detect traces of tribalism in this endeavour, a kind of “noble savage” Romanticism to which the 1960s generation seemed peculiarly prey – à la Robert Pirsig and Carlos Casteneda.8 Walter Ong was not exempt from it, even as he sought to value the ceremonial life of what he called “peoples of simpler culture” and “more primitive peoples” (Ong 1971: 115). Thus, he compares Latin language learning in the Renaissance to the puberty rite, which he sees as “essentially didactic”:

在贝川人中，男孩们赤身裸体地跳舞，村里的男人们一边用长长的鞭子棒打他们，一边问诸如“你会好好保护酋长吗？”之类的问题。或者“你会好好放牛吗？”

Among the Bechuans, the boys in a state of nudity engage in a dance during which the men of the village pummel them with long, whip-like rods while asking such questions as, “Will you guard the chief well?” or “Will you herd the cattle well.”

（翁 1971：117）

(Ong 1971: 117)

在文艺复兴时期，正是拉丁语，而不是识字本身，将男人与男孩、女人、家庭生活和白话识字能力区分开来。这意味着“学习”（即拉丁语知识）几乎完全是男性的成就；学校和大学“强烈让人想起原始社会的男性俱乐部”（120）。因此，即使在表明前现代部落社会的口头文化一直延续到文字时代，翁坚持“原始”（大概与“先进”相对）社会的模式，有时也坚持口头成就的模式，将其局限于未受过教育的人。 、女性、炉边和家庭的白话世界。

In the Renaissance, it was Latin, rather than literacy as such, that separated the men from the boys – and from women, domestic life, and vernacular literacy too. This meant that “learning” (i.e. knowledge in Latin) was an almost exclusively male accomplishment; and that schools and universities were “strongly reminiscent of male clubhouses in primitive societies” (120). Thus, even while showing that the oral culture of pre-modern tribal societies continued into the literate era, Ong persisted with a model of “primitive” (presumably as opposed to “advanced”) societies, and sometimes also with a model of oral accomplishments that confined them to the unlearned, vernacular world of women, hearth and home.

尽管如此，翁在这项研究中的目的并不是要论证从原始文化到美国文化的进步，而是要证明拉丁语的正规学校教育与传统的青春期仪式有多么相似。这是一个令人着迷的见解，引起了文艺复兴时期以外的共鸣。9掌握（并管理）这种学校教育的文艺复兴思想家不仅为现代科学奠定了基础，而且“青春期仪式”的一面也依然存在。Ong 认为，学习拉丁语——一种不被家庭成员（尤其是女性）共享或在社会日常生活中不使用的死语言——为排他感、获得神秘知识和群体内身份形成增加了一个额外的维度。那些学习拉丁语而不仅仅是白话的人。对于 Ong 来说，“社会影响是巨大的”：

Nevertheless, Ong’s purpose in this study was not to argue for progressive advance from primitive to American culture, but to demonstrate how much formal schooling in Latin resembled traditional puberty ceremonials. It’s a fascinating insight, with resonance beyond the Renaissance.9 Not only were the foundations of modern science laid by Renaissance thinkers who mastered (and administered) this kind of schooling, but the “puberty rite” aspect lingers on. Ong argues that the learning of Latin – a dead language not shared by family members (especially women) or used in the everyday life of society – added an extra dimension to the sense of exclusiveness, access to arcane knowledge and in-group identity-formation among those with Latin rather than merely vernacular learning. For Ong, the “social implications were large”:

因为当拉丁语不再被白话使用时，社会中懂拉丁语的人和不懂拉丁语的人之间就出现了明显的区别。在家庭（使用拉丁语以外的语言）和家庭外的学习世界（使用拉丁语）之间存在“边缘环境”的条件。边缘环境主要是语言环境这一事实只会加剧这种情况的启动方面，因为学习秘密含义和交流方式是启动仪式的一个共同特征。正是通过沟通的能力，人获得了归属感。

For when Latin passed out of vernacular usage, a sharp distinction was set up in society between those who knew it and those who did not. The conditions for a “marginal environment” were present... between the family (which as such used a language other than Latin) and an extrafamilial world of learning (which used Latin). The fact that the marginal environment was primarily a linguistic one only heightened the initiatory aspects of the situation, for the learning of secret meanings and means of communication is a common feature of initiatory rites. It is through ability to communicate that man achieves a sense of belonging.

(119)

(119)

在麦克卢汉所说的“地球村”中，也许我们的“进步”并没有像我们想象的那样远远超出部落文化——更不用说文艺复兴了。当他们读到翁的描述时，“男孩的教育基本上是一种青春期仪式，是一个为成年生活做好准备的过程，在一个使他坚强的环境中向他传达过去的遗产，从而保证他守护遗产为了未来”（1971：140），当代学者可能会思考这样的分析在多大程度上描述了研究生教育的经验，至少在美国的大型大学中是如此。

In what McLuhan dubbed the Global Village, perhaps we haven’t “progressed” as far beyond tribal culture – never mind the Renaissance – as we might like to think. As they read Ong’s description of how “a boy’s education was basically a puberty rite, a process preparing him for adult life by communicating to him the heritage of a past in a setting which toughened him and thus guaranteed his guarding the heritage for the future” (1971: 140), contemporary scholars might like to think about how well such an analysis describes the experience of graduate education, at least in big American universities.

转变意识？没那么快...

Transforming consciousness? Not so fast...

尽管其目的是善意的，但教育可以通过弥合口语和识字之间的“鸿沟”来实现“大跃进”的想法仍然存在争议，因为识字史（Graff 1981）和人类心理学（Scribner 和 Cole）的学者1981）对识字（无论是字母还是印刷）是否确实像 Ong 自信地断言的那样改变或“重组”人类意识表示强烈怀疑（口语和识字：第 4 章）。

Despite its well-meaning purpose, the idea that education can take a “great leap forward” by bridging the “great divide” between orality and literacy remains controversial, because scholars of both literacy history (Graff 1981) and human psychology (Scribner and Cole 1981) have expressed strong scepticism about whether literacy, either alphabetic or print, does in fact transform or “restructure” human consciousness as Ong so confidently asserts ( Orality and Literacy : chapter 4).

这个想法的一个问题是写作并不能取代口头表达。印刷并不能取代书写。通常，新媒体技术是对已经使用的媒体技术的补充。因此，读写能力历史学家哈维·格拉夫（Harvey Graff）指出，教育本身“长期以来仍然是一种口头活动”（1991：5），处于口头和读写模式共存的互动过程中。格拉夫试图通过强调识字历史的连续性，将识字研究与渐进变革的理念脱钩（1991：8；另见Graff 1987；Finnegan 1988：139；175）。

One problem with that idea is that writing does not supplant orality; print does not supplant writing. Typically, new media technologies supplement those already in use. Thus, the historian of literacy Harvey Graff has pointed out that education itself “long remained an oral activity” (1991: 5), in an interactive process where oral and literate modes coexist. Graff has sought to de-couple the study of literacy from the idea of progressive change by emphasising continuities in the history of literacy (1991: 8; see also Graff 1987; Finnegan 1988: 139; 175).

事实上，最近的识字教育方法往往回避“大跃进”理论（Street 1984；Daniell 1986）。然而，支持在课堂上使用非印刷媒体的教育活动家经常保留其某些版本或遗迹，以便推动更新广播和数字媒体时代的教学法（和技术）（Kellner 2002） 。但到了二十世纪之交，翁对“媒体素养”教学的影响力已经减弱，以至于在大西洋两岸最有影响力的研究中都没有提到他的名字和麦克卢汉的名字（例如詹金斯）等人，nd；白金汉2003）。

In effect, recent educational approaches to literacy have tended to shy away from “great leap” theory (Street 1984; Daniell 1986). Educational activists in favour of the classroom use of non-print media, however, have often retained some version or vestige of it in order to press the case for updating pedagogies (and technologies) for the era of broadcast and digital media (Kellner 2002). But by the turn of the twenty-first century, Ong’s influence on the teaching of “media literacy” had waned to the point where neither his name nor McLuhan’s is mentioned, on either side of the Atlantic, in the most influential studies (e.g. Jenkins et al, n.d.; Buckingham 2003).

放弃 Ong 是令人遗憾的，因为它把婴儿和洗澡水一起倒掉了。像往常一样，学术批评通常会寻找对手最严重的缺点（同时希望根据自己的最佳特征来评判）。拒绝翁更夸张的主张似乎也导致了他最好的作品被忽视。他没有证据证明他可以脱离他所知道的，即修辞学、技术的历史。口语、书写（手写识字能力）和印刷识字能力之间的“思维”区别，以及他不知道的东西：心灵。他的主张是，从一种知识技术（言语）到另一种知识技术（书写）的历史性转变“重组”了人类意识，这是一种简单的过度概括。它不能做到这一点，除非声称即使是那些不能或不阅读（更不用说写作）的人以及来自其他文化的人的意识也会被他们不熟悉的修辞传统和媒体技术所改变。不要使用。无论书写、印刷、广播、电子通信和数字媒体等技术多么普遍，它们都是社会制度（文化），而不是人类属性（自然）。Ong关于“人类意识”的言论本质上是转移注意力，因为他对学术的贡献就其本身而言是实质性且令人着迷的——学习系统的历史。他不需要从社会学习推断人类意识。

This turn away from Ong is regrettable, because it throws the baby out with the bathwater. As usual, academic criticism routinely looks for opponents’ worst faults (while wishing to be judged on its own best features). Rejection of Ong’s more exorbitant claims seems to have led to the neglect of his best work too. He had no evidential warrant to step from what he knew about, i.e. the history of rhetorical, technological and “noetic” distinctions between orality, writing (chirographic literacy) and print-literacy, to what he didn’t know about: the mind. His claim, that the historical shift from one technology of knowledge (speech) to another (writing) “restructures” human consciousness, is a simple over-generalisation. It can’t do this, unless the claim is made that even the consciousness of those who can’t or don’t read (much less write), and those from other cultures, is transformed by rhetorical traditions and media technologies they don’t use. No matter how pervasive they may be, technologies like writing, print, broadcasting, electronic communication and digital media are all social institutions (culture) rather than human attributes (nature). Ong’s talk about “human consciousness” was essentially a red herring, because what he contributed to scholarship was something substantial and fascinating in its own terms – the history of learning systems. He did not need to extrapolate from social learning to human consciousness.

有几次，即使在试图解决性别问题时，翁似乎也暗示意识实际上是按照性别划分的（例如，1971：119-20；口语和识字：111-12、156-7；2002：483- 4). 但是，正如他不是神经科学家一样，他对女孩也了解不多：“我们在这里只关心男孩，因为一般来说，只有男孩在文艺复兴时期的学校里接受教育，或者接受教育。系统的正规教育”（1971：117）。这是最不经过深思熟虑的技术决定论；似乎表明，因为某些东西被改变了（通信技术），所以一切是（人类意识），即使它不是（女性意识）。Ong 对“仪式性战斗”在教育和男子气概中的作用很感兴趣。但他对这一主题的整本书的副标题《为生命而战：竞争、性和意识》（1981）显示了他的影响力如何超出了他的理解：“竞争”和“性”可能在教育机构中联系在一起，但这并不需要人类“意识”的转变——这里的知识超出了自身的范围。

Several times, even as he is trying to address gender issues, Ong seems to suggest that consciousness is in fact divided along gender lines (e.g. 1971: 119–20; Orality and Literacy : 111–12, 156–7; 2002: 483–4). But, just as he was no neuroscientist, so he didn’t know much about girls: “We are concerned with the boys alone here, for, generally speaking, it is boys alone who are taught in Renaissance schools, or who are given a systematic formal education” (1971: 117). Here is technological determinism at its least thoughtful; seeming to suggest that because something was transformed (communications technologies), then everything was (human consciousness), even when it wasn’t (women’s consciousness). Ong was interested in the role of “ceremonial combat” in both education and masculinity. But the subtitle of his book-length treatment of this topic, Fighting For Life: Contest, Sexuality, and Consciousness (1981), shows how his reach exceeded his grasp: “contest” and “sexuality” may be linked in educational institutions, but that does not entail a transformation of human “consciousness” – here was knowledge overreaching itself.

但相反的错误也需要避免。仅仅因为翁最极端的假设是由他从他的主题概括或普遍化到“人类”的习惯造成的，这是错误的，但这并不意味着其他一切都是错误的。我们所有人都会做出愚蠢的言论。但这不应该让我们忽视 Ong所做的事情 了解，这是知识技术的历史，无论是诸如写作和新闻之类的硬件，还是诸如修辞或空间化方法之类的软件。在这里，他绝对是在做某事，那就是文化进化。

But the opposite fault also needs to be avoided. Just because Ong’s most extreme assumptions, which are caused by his habit of generalising or universalising from his topic to “mankind,” are wrongheaded, it does not follow that everything else is wrong too. Silly statements are made, as they are by us all. But that should not blind us to what Ong did know about, which was the history of technologies of knowledge, whether hardware such as writing and the press, or software like rhetoric or spatialised method. Here he was definitely on to something, and that something was cultural evolution.

翁格主义的演变

The evolution of Ongism

翁对进化论很感兴趣。事实上，他在《口语和读写能力》中给出了最后的结论：

Ong flirted with evolutionary theory. In fact he gave it the last word in Orality and Literacy:

至少从黑格尔时代开始，人们越来越意识到人类意识的进化……口语-读写能力的动态完整地融入了现代意识的进化中。

Since at least the time of Hegel, awareness has been growing that human consciousness evolves... Orality-literacy dynamics enter integrally into the modern evolution of consciousness.

（口语和读写能力：174-6）

(Orality and Literacy: 174–6)

当仅仅在人文学科的公共休息室里说出这个词就会引起恐慌（理由是进化论=社会达尔文主义=纳粹主义）时，提及进化论可能被视为一个大胆的举动。然而，对于我们后道金斯时代的人来说，奇怪的是，这段话引入了宗教内在性的头脑，而不是达尔文。翁可能根本不是达尔文进化论：他写的是“意识的现代进化”，而不是“现代意识的进化”。在这里，词序可能会产生很大的影响，因为“现代进化”可能只是意味着“历史性变化”（最多 5000 年），而“现代进化”是一个达尔文问题（最少 50,000 年）。不管; 当今的媒体学术受到马克思主义政治经济学的影响，对工业化和阶级斗争带来的变化更感兴趣。在这里，意识的变化当然受到支持，但被解释为经济和制度过程的结果，而不是进化过程的结果：研究的对象不是“意识的进化”，而是“意识产业”（Enzensberger 1970；1974）。

At a time when merely to utter that word in a Humanities common-room could cause consternation (on the grounds that evolution = social Darwinism = Nazism), mention of evolution may be seen as a bold move. Nevertheless, strangely to our post-Dawkins ear, the passage it introduces heads of to religious interiority, not to Darwin. It is possible that Ong didn’t mean Darwinian evolution at all: he writes of “the modern evolution of consciousness” rather than “the evolution of modern consciousness.” Here, word order may make quite a difference, since “modern evolution of ” may just mean “historic change” (5000 years max), where “evolution of modern” is a Darwinian question (50,000 years minimum). No matter; the media scholarship of the day, influenced by Marxist political economy, was more interested in changes wrought by industrialisation and class struggle. Here, changes in consciousness were certainly countenanced, but were explained as the outcome of economic and institutional processes not evolutionary ones: the object of study wasn’t the “evolution of consciousness” but “the consciousness industry” (Enzensberger 1970; 1974).

但秘密已经泄露了：Ong 引用了“个体发生和系统发生”的进化论（Orality and Literacy : 175：见 Gould 1977），作为他与口头、然后是识字和基于印刷的变化背后的因果机制。意识。当时，这这只不过是一种预感。翁正处于思想史上的一个阶段，当时人们怀疑媒体技术、认知和文化变迁之间存在某种因果关系，但考虑到当时的生物科学、认知心理学和文学史的状况，很难证明这一点。他这一代人的思想实验，由麦克卢汉、古迪、瓦特、哈夫洛克等人进行，是大胆的、有影响力的，但无法验证，甚至无法与其他科学进行三角测量。“意识的进化”仍然是一个挑衅性的隐喻，而不是一个实质性探究的领域。生物科学（遗传学）、心理学（大脑）和文本学术（复杂网络意义系统）在内部或相互关系上都没有得到充分发展，

But the cat was out of the bag: Ong had invoked evolution, “ontogenetically and phylogenetically” ( Orality and Literacy : 175: and see Gould 1977), as the causal mechanism behind the changes he associated with oral, then literate and print-based consciousness. At the time, this was little more than a hunch. Ong was part of a phase in the history of ideas when some causal connection between media technologies, cognition, and cultural change was suspected but hard to prove given the then state of bioscience, cognitive psychology, and literary history. The thought-experiments of his generation, conducted by the likes of McLuhan, Goody and Watt, Havelock etc., were bold and influential but impossible to verify or even to triangulate with other sciences. The “evolution of consciousness” remained a provocative metaphor rather than a field of substantive inquiry. Biological science (genetics), psychology (the brain), and textual scholarship (complex-networked meaning systems) were not sufficiently developed, internally or in relation to each other, to attempt to isolate evolutionary causal mechanisms in the study of technologies of consciousness, whether internal like speech or external like writing (but see Lotman 2009).

自 1982 年以来，时代发生了变化。这些变化之一是科学与人文学科之间加速的“一致性”（Wilson 1998），包括使用源自进化论或新达尔文理论、复杂性或网络理论的方法来研究文学和文化主题的各种尝试，以及遗传生物科学，包括神经科学和进化心理学。在当前进化科学的工作中，Ong 对进化的兴趣以他无法预见的方式得到体现（Mesoudi 2011）；这项工作表明我们确实可以通过进化论来理解文化和意识，不仅仅是作为变化的松散隐喻，而是作为社会和文化以及生物科学中新达尔文主义转向的一部分（博伊德和里克森） 1985）。随着生物科学、神经科学、进化和复杂性理论（例如 Kaufiman 1995）乃至人文学科中进化和复杂系统方法的快速发展，现在是时候重新讨论与变化相关的“意识进化”问题了。在通信技术和媒体方面。这项工作的指导者包括 Brian Arthur (2009)，他自己关于技术进化的引人注目的理论迫切需要应用于通信技术；布莱恩·博伊德（Brian Boyd，2009）在荷马和故事演变以及文学进化方法方面的研究为这一新兴领域的未来树立了一个良好的标准。许多其他人现在正在为一个新兴的 Kaufiman 1995），甚至在人文学科中，现在也是时候重新讨论与技术和传播媒介的变化相关的“意识的进化”问题了。这项工作的指导者包括 Brian Arthur (2009)，他自己关于技术进化的引人注目的理论迫切需要应用于通信技术；布莱恩·博伊德（Brian Boyd，2009）在荷马和故事演变以及文学进化方法方面的研究为这一新兴领域的未来树立了一个良好的标准。许多其他人现在正在为一个新兴的 Kaufiman 1995），甚至在人文学科中，现在也是时候重新讨论与技术和传播媒介的变化相关的“意识的进化”问题了。这项工作的指导者包括 Brian Arthur (2009)，他自己关于技术进化的引人注目的理论迫切需要应用于通信技术；布莱恩·博伊德（Brian Boyd，2009）在荷马和故事演变以及文学进化方法方面的研究为这一新兴领域的未来树立了一个良好的标准。许多其他人现在正在为一个新兴的 他自己关于技术进化的令人信服的理论迫切需要应用于通信技术；布莱恩·博伊德（Brian Boyd，2009）在荷马和故事演变以及文学进化方法方面的研究为这一新兴领域的未来树立了一个良好的标准。许多其他人现在正在为一个新兴的 他自己关于技术进化的令人信服的理论迫切需要应用于通信技术；布莱恩·博伊德（Brian Boyd，2009）在荷马和故事演变以及文学进化方法方面的研究为这一新兴领域的未来树立了一个良好的标准。许多其他人现在正在为一个新兴的关于进化论和艺术的座谈会，例如奥斯汀（2010）；博伊德等人（2010）；卡罗尔（2011）；迪萨纳亚克 (2000) 和达顿 (2009)。对于其中一些工作的批评，请参阅 Kramnick (2011)。10

Times have changed since 1982. Among the changes is an accelerating “consilience” (Wilson 1998) between sciences and humanities, including various attempts to study literary and cultural topics using approaches derived from evolutionary or neo-Darwinian theory, complexity or network theory, and genetic biosciences including neuroscience and evolutionary psychology. Ong’s interest in evolution has been taken up in ways he could not have foreseen, in current work in the evolutionary sciences (Mesoudi 2011); work that suggests we may indeed be able to understand culture and consciousness through evolutionary theory, not simply as a loose metaphor for change, but as part of the neo-Darwinian turn in the social and cultural as well as the biological sciences (Boyd and Richerson 1985). Following rapid development of evolutionary and complex-systems approaches in the biosciences, neurosciences, evolutionary and complexity theory (e.g. Kaufiman 1995) and eventually even in the humanities, it is timely to reopen the question of the “evolution of consciousness” in relation to changes in the technologies and media of communication. Guides to this work include Brian Arthur (2009), whose own compelling theorising about technological evolution cries out to be applied to technologies of communication; and Brian Boyd (2009), whose work on Homer and the evolution of stories, and on evolutionary approaches to literature, has set a standard that augurs well for the future of this nascent field. Many others are now contributing to an emergent colloquy on evolution and the arts, for instance Austin (2010); Boyd et al (2010); Carroll (2011); Dissanayake (2000) and Dutton (2009). For a critique of some of this work, see Kramnick (2011).10

将 Ong 的作品置于更广泛的跨学科背景中，将他的“思维”思想史方法不仅与进化论和系统思维联系起来，而且还与当代“科学的科学”领域联系起来。11媒体技术可以作为影响许多领域的“进化转向”的一部分来研究，汇集生物科学、文献研究以及网络或复杂性理论的见解，以了解我们的物种适应技术和增长的进化变化的程度的知识。当您现在阅读 Ong 的书时，您会想到 John Brockman（The Edge 1999）所说的“分布式网络智能”。你不仅在思考它，而且在思考它。你也参与其中。

Setting Ong’s work in this wider, interdisciplinary context links his “noetic” history-of-ideas approach not only with evolutionary and systems thinking but also with the contemporary field of the “science of science.”11 Media technologies can be studied as part of the “evolutionary turn” affecting many fields, bringing together insights from biosciences, textual studies, and network or complexity theory to understand the extent to which our species is adapting to evolutionary changes in the technologies and growth of knowledge. When you read Ong’s book now, you’re thinking about what John Brockman (The Edge 1999) called “Distributed Networked Intelligence.” You’re not only thinking about it; you’re participating in it too.

当你这样做时，想想匿名的“第一公民”在听莎士比亚的《凯撒大帝》中马克·安东尼著名的“把你的耳朵借给我”演讲时所说的话，他说：“我认为他的话中有很多道理。” 12 Walter J. Ong 也可以这样说。

As you do, consider the words of the anonymous “First Citizen” listening to Mark Antony’s famous “lend me your ears” speech in Shakespeare’s Julius Caesar, who remarks: “Methinks there is much reason in his sayings.”12 The same might be said of Walter J. Ong.

笔记

Notes

1 Google Scholar 访问时间：2012 年 6 月。

1 Google Scholar accessed June 2012.

2 John Naughton，《观察家报》（2012 年 1 月 8 日）：www. Guardian.co.uk/technology/2012/jan/08/john-brockman-edge-interview-johnnaughton?newsfeed=true。本次采访讨论了麦克卢汉对布罗克曼的影响。

2 John Naughton, in the Observer (8 January 2012): www. guardian.co.uk/technology/2012/jan/08/john-brockman-edge-interview-johnnaughton?newsfeed=true. McLuhan’s influence on Brockman is discussed in this interview.

3请参阅 The Edge (1999) 的所有 114 篇贡献。

3 See all 114 contributions at The Edge (1999).

4那些控制出版的人控制了“公共思想”，用克莱·舍基（Clay Shirky）的精彩话说：“在这个制度中，公开事物是一种特权活动，受益者，无论是学者还是政治家，记者还是医生，都会抱怨新的大量信息的方式。公众思想颠覆了旧秩序，但这些抱怨就像守灵一样；他们担心的变化已经成为过去。真正的行动在别处。” www.edge.org/q2010/q10_1.html#shirky（参见 Brockman 2012）。

4 Those who controlled publishing controlled “public thought,” in Clay Shirky’s excellent phrase: “The beneficiaries of the system where making things public was a privileged activity, whether academics or politicians, reporters or doctors, will complain about the way the new abundance of public thought upends the old order, but those complaints are like keening at a wake; the change they fear is already in the past. The real action is elsewhere.” www.edge.org/ q2010/q10_1.html#shirky (and see Brockman 2012).

5翁和麦克卢汉并不是唯一对“新教”美国投以“天主教”目光的中世纪主义者——翁贝托·艾柯后来也做到了这一点，他的《超现实之旅》（1987）尽管艾柯已经离开在他攻读博士学位期间，他进入了天主教会（研究托马斯·阿奎那的美学）。请参阅：www.themodernword.com/eco/eco_biography.html。

5 Ong and McLuhan wouldn’t be the only medievalists to cast a “catholic” eye over “protestant” America – Umberto Eco did it later, with his Travels in Hyperreality (1987), although Eco had left the Catholic Church during his doctorate studies (on aesthetics in Thomas Aquinas). See: www.themodernword.com/eco/eco_ biography.html.

6参见：www.bbc.co.uk/ahistoryoftheworld。

6 See: www.bbc.co.uk/ahistoryoftheworld.

7甚至历史学家也开始以对立的方式思考：彼得·拉斯莱特（Peter Laslett）颇具影响力的著作《我们失去的世界》（The World We Have Lost，2004 年；1965 年首次出版）在试图描述一个阅读和写作是罕见成就的社会时触及了其中一些问题，这与当代社会强调——并将他的标题中的“我们”与他所说的“过去的过去”区分开来。

7 Even the historians began to think in paired oppositions: Peter Laslett’s influential book The World We Have Lost (2004; first published 1965) touches on some of these issues in trying to describe a society where reading and writing were rare accomplishments, a difference from contemporary society that emphasises – and separates the “we” of his title from – what he called “the pastness of the past.”

8罗伯特·波西格 (Robert Pirsig) 的《禅宗与摩托车维修艺术》(1974 年) 和卡洛斯·卡斯塔内达 (Carlos Castaneda) 的《唐璜的教义》(1968 年) 都试图从非西方或部落模式中汲取智慧；有趣的是，两者都是从学术论文开始的（参见：davidlavery.net/Collected_Works/Essays/Dissertations_as_Fictions.pdf，第 3 页）。

8 Robert Pirsig’s Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance (1974) and Carlos Castaneda’s The Teachings of Don Juan (1968), both sought to derive wisdom from non-Western or tribal models; interestingly, both started life as academic dissertations (see: davidlavery.net/Collected_Works/Essays/Dissertations_as_Fictions.pdf, p. 3).

9我在 Hartley (2012) 中进一步讨论了此类共振。

9 I discuss such resonances further in Hartley (2012).

10维基百科关于“达尔文文学研究”的条目（2012 年 1 月访问）很好。

10 The Wikipedia entry on “Darwinian literary studies” (accessed January 2012) is good.

11例如参见《经济学人》(2011)。

11 See for instance The Economist (2011).

12威廉·莎士比亚 (1599) 凯撒大帝，III.ii.108：shakespeare.mit.edu/julius_caesar/julius_caesar.3.2.html；并参见第 2 页的注释 2。二十四，同上。

12 William Shakespeare (1599) Julius Caesar, III.ii.108: shakespeare.mit.edu/julius_caesar/julius_caesar.3.2.html; and see note 2, p. xxiv, above.
